From Leaf's shoulder, you shot the guy a bothered look.

"What do we even care?" you whispered to Leaf, who giggled,
"Just walk away."

"Quiet you, and watch." Leaf replied, so quietly that the bug-catcher heard nothing.

The giantess shot the trainer in front of her a confident smile and held her Pokeball up, accepting the challenge; the bug-catcher grinned.

"Great!" he shouted, holding out a Pokeball as well,
"Then let's begin with this, Metapod!"

As soon as the Pokeball was tossed, a shell-covered green Pokemon popped out, causing Leaf to sigh.

These guys really had a one-sided mind, and Metapod was their trademark Pokemon; the only worse people were those fishermen trying to take her on with their team consisting solely of Magikarp.

Looking down at the Pokeball she was holding, Leaf pondered something for a moment, before putting it back, deciding to show off later. Instead, she grabbed a second Pokeball.

"Ninetales." she called, tossing her Pokeball, letting the majestic, nine-tailed fox come out once more.

"What, do I have to play the babysitter again?" she cried, before looking in front of her, noticing some guy with a Metapod; much like her trainer, Ninetales sighed.

This was even worse than babysitting Chikorita!

Annoyed, Ninetales turned to shoot Leaf a glare, but spotted you on her shoulder and the frown instantly turned into a smile.

"Okay, guess I'm doing this..."

"You can have the first move!" the bug-catcher spoke confidently, leading you to wonder if he was even aware that his Metapod not only had a huge type disadvantage, but was facing a fully evolved Pokemon as well; that, and Metapod commonly knew only how to use Harden, so...

"Ninetales, Flamethrower." Leaf commanded, interrupting your thoughts as you focused on the battle.

Ninetales did as told.

The result was pretty predictable... only it wasn't.

"Metapod, use String Shot!" the trainer ordered; his Pokemon instantly shot a thick string from its mouth... only it wasn't aiming at its opponent, but rather aimed at a nearby branch. The string stuck to it, causing Metapod to literally fly away, dodging the attack.

"What?" you said, surprised. Could String Shot even be used like that!?

"Now, Metapod, use Harden and attack!" the bug-catcher commanded.

Leaf huffed. Harden, to attack? Come on...

However, the giantess was shocked when Metapod followed the order, hardening its shell, before using the momentum of String Shot to fling itself at Ninetales, who hastily jumped back as the other Pokemon smashed the ground with a steel-hard shell.

Leaf was surprised, and so were you, but your giant caretaker soon smirked.

"A combination of Harden and String Shot to use a defensive move as an attack... clever." Leaf commented.

All the bug-catchers she had faced so far were as dumb as their Metapods' shells were hard, but this one made the exception.

This was going to be interesting, after all.

--

The battle between Ninetales and Metapod continued only for a bit longer, before the vixen finally managed to hit the opponent, knocking it out with one, super-effective blow.

Next up was a Parasect, who put up more than a fight that Metapod did, and even managed to paralyze Ninetales with Stun Spore, but in the end, it was no match for the much more experienced fire-type commanded by Leaf.

This left the bug-catcher only with one Pokemon.

"Okay, here comes my ace! Venomoth!" he called out as he threw his last Pokeball, letting out a large, purple-grey moth with huge eyes.

Leaf hesitated for a moment, then held Ninetales' Pokeball up and called her back.

"She's paralyzed, so I'll let her rest," she whispered to you, before holding out another Pokeball,
"Now, remember my fourth Pokemon?"

"Yeah...?"

"Dragonite." Leaf spoke, throwing her Pok- did she just say 'Dragonite'?

Eyes glued to the sphere, you watched as it opened and out came a yellow dragon.

You were bewildered, Dragonite were so rare to find that people believed they didn't exist! How did Leaf manage to catch such a powerful beast...?

Even the bug-catcher seemed as surprised as you were, but didn't give up.

"Okay Venomoth, use-"

"Extreme Speed." Leaf ordered; Dragonite flew towards its opponent, so fast that it practically disappeared.

Venomoth didn't know what hit it when he was sent flying and crashed into a tree, getting knocked out in one attack; by the time the bug-catcher looked back at Leaf, she was already calling back a very satisfied-looking Dragonite back.

"Y-You're so powerful! I didn't stand a chance!" Leaf's has-been opponent stuttered.

Leaf simply smiled and turned around, wordlessly waving as she walked away.

"Y-You're so powerful! I wouldn't stand a chance!" you stuttered once Leaf put some distance between her and her ex-opponent.

Leaf rolled her eyes.

"Oh, hush. Bug-types aren't that powerful, but they are pretty bothersome, as you saw with Ninetales... who I'm going to have to heal once we get to Goldenrod." she sighed.

"You seem to know what you're doing very well..." you pointed out.

Leaf giggled.

"Well, I am the third most Powerful trainer in Kanto, so I'd say so." she said.

You chuckled as well.

"Not very modest, are you?" you teased.

Leaf brought a hand to you and poked you in the middle of the chest in response, knocking the air out of your lungs and nearly causing you to fall off of her shoulder; luckily, you were quick enough to grab onto a strand of hair and pulled yourself back up.

"W-What was that for!?"

Leaf stuck her tongue out in response and kept going.

You sighed, hoping you weren't going to meet anymore trainers... and that you weren't going to face anymore surprises from Leaf along the way.
11232123222112.title: Pokemon battle!

choices: You should just show me, gotta accept i'm small
Hide me, for now at least
"Wow, is that a small guy!" A girl with Pink haired said (Whitney)
112321232221121.content:
After Leaf honestly destroyed that Pokemon Trainer with no care, she went on with her journey. She began to move for a long time, as you two chat. So she had a Dragonite. Apparently she caught her in the Safari when she was just a Dratini, and trained her up to a powerful Pokemon. To say she was impressed about it would be an understatement. This Pokemon not only had high stats, it took to a Pokemon battle like it was bread.

“Wow, seems like you lucked out. I mean, can you even beat a Dragonite?” You question her as she smiled.

“It’s only lost twice. Once when I was using my Blastoise in a test match. He skilfully defeated her. To say she was angry about that would be an understatement. On the other side, it was a Tyranitar.” She said as you listened.

“Really, a Tyranitar bet it?” You say back to her.

“It was the oddest thing to me. There was this trainer, a couple of years younger then me and with red hair. Said his name was Silver. He confronted me, and both of us fought for a long time. I won the battle, but his Pokemon were so much stronger than I thought it was. Not to mention, the way he faced me... it was almost like he had a vendetta.”

“Well, glad I ended up with you rather than him.” You say with a smile. “Also, when it comes to Pokemon, you’re really passionate. You talk so much more.”

“Do I?” She questioned as she moved on, almost like it was some kind of joke.

“Hop.”

“Hop Hop.”

“Pip! pip! Hoppip!” A sound said as you paid attention. Turning your head and looking at a herd of Hoppips. The Pink Pokemon all in a bunch.

“Hey look at that, a Bunch of Hoppip’s.” You say to her, however one faint look at her and she just kept on looking. Getting you to question. “What not going to catch it?”

“They are not really interesting to me. I want to catch Pokemon I like, not the ones I don’t.” She said as you guess you could understand that.

“Well can’t argue there. Still, personally I really liked them.” You say to her as she smiled.

“Well maybe you should of caught one of them.”

You think about it for a while and laugh. “Yeah, and carry around a beach ball size Pokeball. I’ve never actually caught a Pokemon before.”

“Maybe you will, on this journey of yours.” She said with a smile, as you did give that a long think. Maybe you will.

-

“Finally here, not much trouble it seems.” She said with a smile. Despite that admittedly courageous trainer, it has been smooth sailing to Goldenrod. Smiling as she walked around, to the inner city as she looked around. Now while she could go over and face the gym right now, she does decide not to do that. There was about... an hour and a half of sunlight, and there was a couple of places she wanted to go to. Not to mention.

“Leaf... i’m hungry.” You whine to her, as you really have not eaten anything all day. She wasn’t exactly the one to carry food with her, well human food that was.

Walking into the city she moved you around and held in her palm. You two discussed this and came to the conclusion it was the best way. Her fingers up to stop your sight from most people.

“I am too, but i’m not complaining about it.” She said simply. “I’ll get you some food, but after that there are a couple of spots I want to check out. Apparently there is a day care on the outskirts, not to mention a Bike Shop.”

“A Bike Shop?”

“Riding a Bike would of cut that trip time in third, i’ve been meaning to get one my last one broke.” She said as you gave her a smile.

“If you do buy one, can you buy one with a basket so I can ride up there.” Despite her not showing it, Leaf found this idea to be super cute. She was so going to do that.

First food though, and where was she going. Not to be a girl too stubborn, she moved around and asked.

Going to a civilian. An old lady in fact. “Hi, i’m just a trainer who was visiting. I was wondering, if you can tell me where the best place to eat will be.”

“Oh, hello dear,” The woman said, as you hide behind the not threatening girl’s fingers. “Well there is this delightful sweet shop not too far from here, down that street. If you and your little boyfriend wants to go to eat somewhere, I would say there. Hi there sweetie.”

Okay, so she’s waving you and that means spotted you. You peek your head out at the old woman and wave back.

She wore a giant smile as she just left, and you had to comment. “She seemed worryingly too relaxed about seeing me.”

“True.”

(She’s the Daycare Woman by the way)

Leaf moved on and followed her instructions, walking down the street as she kept her eye out. It was really easy to spot it and she wore a smile. She was hungry just like you, so she was going to look forward to this.

She walked a couple of steps closer, when she suddenly stopped. There was a lot of people in there, so maybe she should hide you better.

Then again, if you were going to be this small for a while, you were going to have to get use to being in a crowd of giant people. She did the polite thing and looked down to you, giving you the question there.

“Do you want to hide, or be out in the open?” She questioned. You paused for a couple of seconds as you look at her. Really giving it another thought.

“I think _________”
112321232221121.title: Leaf At Goldenrod

choices: Leaf managed to beat Whitney
Whitney got the upper hand
Whitney won, but offered her badge in exchange for... you!
1123212322211213.content:
"I think I'd be more comfortable if you did hi-"

You never finished speaking.

"Wow!" a girlish voice spoke as a pink-haired girl stood up from a nearby table, eyes sparkling and her mouth displaying an incredibly large smile,
"Is that a small guy!?" she asked, approaching Leaf, so fast that you didn't see her leaving her seat.

You felt a drop of sweat rolling down the back of your neck - so much for hiding!

In order not to draw attention, at least not more than she already had thanks to the girl, Leaf quietly stepped back outside; however, the girl followed her and, once she caught up, she began barraging Leaf with questions,

"Excuse me! I just happened to notice your little boyfriend, why is he so small, how is it possible, he's very cute, I'm almost kind of jealous-"

As the girl kept speaking, you saw Leaf blushing as the pink-head mentioned that you were her boyfriend.

So, seeing as Leaf was saying nothing, you spoke up,

"Excuse me, miss," you said, raising your voice a little, getting her to stop to look at you,
"I'm so small because of a Pokemon... and we're not dating!"

The girl gasped.

"That means you're available!" she exclaimed, leaning in so close that Leaf had to take three steps back.

"Who're you?" she asked, shooting a wary look

The girl stopped for a moment, blushed, then began rubbing the back of her head in a flustered manner.

"Hehe, I'm sorry, I got really excited!" she apologized.

You could tell about that last part.

Finally though, you got the chance to take a good look at her; she was wearing a white and pink shirt and shorts upon striped socks fitted into a pair of sneakers.

"My name is Whitney, by the way." 'Whitney' finally introduced herself.

... 'Whitney'?

You and Leaf exchanged a look, before she turned to the pink-headed girl.

"Are you the gym leader here, by any chance?" she asked.

Whitney smiled.

"Hehe, yup! That would be me!" she said in a cheerful tone, before offering a knowing smile,
"Why, do you want to take on my gym?" she asked, her eyes then fixing on you as she winked,
"Or maybe you do?"

"Do I look like I c-"

"I'll be your challenger." Leaf quietly stepped in and, for a moment, Whitney's gaze and hers met in a competitive manner... right before Leaf's tummy loudly reminded her that she had other plans before the challenge.

"Um... right after we catch some lunch." Leaf muttered with a blush; your own stomach grumbled as well.

Whitney giggled.

"In that case..." she said, grabbing Leaf by the hand, starting to drag her back to the shop, catching Leaf by surprise,
"I'll be happy to treat both you and your little friend to lunch! I wouldn't want you taking me on on an empty stomach, hehe!"

Before Leaf could reply, she realized that nothing was going to stop Whitney and quietly grabbed her hat, moving it over to her shoulder, muttering,

"Jump in. I'll save something for you, promise."

You didn't think twice and did as told, understanding that Leaf meant to hide you so you had no more unwanted attention; once you landed, Leaf put her hat back on as she was dragged back into the shop.

--

Some time later, both trainers walked back to the Goldenrod Gym; along the way, Leaf let you out of your 'safe spot' to let you eat whatever she had gotten for you.

In the meantime, the two giantesses you were with were having a conversation, though you were far more focused on filling your stomach than listening.

"So, tell me," Whitney was saying,
"How many badges do you have?"

"I have six." Leaf replied.

"Ooooh, you must be super tough! I'll have to use my best Pokemon to defeat you! Hehehe!" the gym leader replied excitedly, thrilled by the idea of an actual challenge; she usually beat her opponents rather quickly.

Whitney and Leaf eventually arrived to the gym, where the former, smirking confidently, headed straight for the battlefield; Leaf followed quietly, standing on her end of the field while the pink-haired gym leader stood on the opposite side.

Whitney wore a smirk of determination.

"So let's get started straightaway! You don't need me telling you the rules, do you?" she asked, holding a Pokeball.

Leaf shook her head, then grabbed her own Pokeball; the two trainers then tossed their spheres in the air, officially starting the match.
1123212322211213.title: Goldenrod's Gym Leader

choices: Was angry she lost! She's not giving the badge!
Was upset, she needs you to comfort her!
Has a made up second Gym challenge. For you to take!
11232123222112131.content:
And so the battle began, you got a pretty good view of it on Leaf’s shoulder as they both tossed out their Pokeballs. You see it land down in front of Leaf, as Chikorita came out. Ready and raring to go. You wear a smile seeing her once again, although you were glad you were not near it.

As for Whitney, she tossed out her Pokeball and out came Girafarig. Both of them ready.

“Go get her Chikorita.” Leaf said as you speak up.

“Y-You got this!” Chikorita turned her head, seeing you and grew a smile. Not only was she going to prove herself, she was gonna impress you.

“Ready!” Whitney said very loud about it. So the battle began. She brought out Chikorita first because as her weakest, it makes sense to face Whitney’s weakest.

However... well she was not on the level of the Pokemon she was facing. You could see Chikorita really try and beat the Pokemon. A Razor Leaf as well as Vine Whips. Neither of them were going to work, as Girafarig held the Pokemon in place with Psychic, and hit it with a Shadow Ball! Your eyes wide open as you see the Pokemon down.

“One hit...”

“Return.” Leaf said as she looked at the Pokeball. “Thank you for trying.”

“Barely any damage to Girafarig! Easy win!” Whitney said with a playful taunt. Leaf responded with tossing her own Pokeball, as down came Ninetails.

The Pokemon ready to fight, and when it looked at you, she was going to show off.

So the battle continued again from the loud girl and the quiet girl. The fight lasted for a long while, as both of them were high level although Ninetails clearly had the advantage.

It was the way she was moving, just elegantly dodging around and avoiding it. The way she moved was... memorising in a way.

And it took a good Will O Wisp, Flamethrower combination to get it. The Pokemon got hit hard, and it fell back. After a few more, the Pokemon was done.

Ninetails turned back to you two, and she smiled.

“I hope that impressed you.” She said, doing what Chikorita tried. That could prove troublesome for later.

“J-Just because you bet one, don’t get cocky! Here comes Clefable!”

Her new Pokemon came down and landed in front of you.

“Clef!” It said ready for battle. Seeming like a giant pillow to you. You actually enjoy watching this as it started. Leaf giving out quiet commands, Whitney giving loud commands. It would seem they were quite different, still got along.

As for Clefable against Ninetails, it was a lot closer. Ninetails was a bit hurt from her bout with Girafarig, but she was willing to go. The Clefable had a lot of moves though. Light Screen to stop Flamethrower, Will O Wisp couldn’t get a good hit in and none of her other moves worked.

While Clefable had a good Thunder and although Ninetails dodged a lot, one hit that happened really hurt her.

“This isn’t good, she can’t take another!”

Leaf didn’t waver though, as she made sure to use her Pokemon’s talented movement to not only avoid, but get her hits in. When the Will O Wisp was hit, she started to make good moves. Light Screen didn’t work on every side, and with the amount of time she moved around Clefable was a sitting Ducklett.

It would seem it finally ended. Another well placed Flamethrower to send the Pokemon down. However Clefable got one move as well, a powerful Thunder Wave that left the Pokemon stunned.

So although Whitney is down one Pokemon, Ninetails couldn’t survive. Still she came back and wore a smile on her face. Twitching because of the Thunder Wave. “O-Once again. I co-ome out-t Vict-toriu-us.” She said as she was not ready.

“Ninetails return.” Leaf said bringing her Pokemon back in.

“I just got to get rid of this last one and Ninetails will be easy pickings! Come on out Milktank!”

The giant cow did just that, dropping right into the middle as it flexed. “Milk!”

“That’s the ace. You gotta be careful.” You look to Leaf’s face as she had a serious face.

“My ace is better.” And with that, she brought her ball and tossed it down. Tossing it down onto the field as you see her giant and large Blastoise.

“He’s a big boy.” You had to comment.

“Blast!”

“Easy win!” She said, as they both started to act. Blastoise going in as well as Milktank.

You didn’t know who was going to win. You could see that Milktank was getting the advantage though. Both took good hits, but with Stomp and Milk Drink, Milktank got the better out of the two. Blastoise also had more range moves such as Hydro Pump. He’s ace not being able to be used.

Milktank healed and Blastoise got hurt. “Leaf, what are we going to do!?” You question wanting to know. Looking to the side and seeing the giant Pokemon trainer that was there.

However she was confident, waiting and biding her time. You don’t know what, but as it turns out.

“Now let’s start the Rollout!” Whitney said to her Pokemon as it rolled and started going to Blastoise.

“Now! Blastoise Skull Bash!” Leaf yelled, passionate about the fight. Both of them go together, hitting hard as it made you freak out. Like two cannons firing into each other. Blastoise pushed the Pokemon back making it fly.

“-Hey!”

“Now Milktank is locked in that move. While it does get stronger, so can Blastoise. Withdraw!”

The Pokemon did just that, sharpening it’s defence as Milktank came once again.

Whitney was stuck in a loop, and the Blastoise won. A couple more conflicts of hits, and Milktank stop spinning, out of the fight!


“That was amazing! We won!” You say as you see the Blastoise smile about it as well. Leaf was of course glad she won.

Whitney on the other hand though ____________
11232123222112131.title: Leaf's Talant

choices: You managed to outrun Whitney and reached Leaf!
Whitney caught you!
You made it, but an irritated Whitney came up with something else
112321232221121313.content:
Whitney wasn't happy.

Not. One. Bit.

Usually, whenever trainers came to her gym, she would beat them in a matter of minutes; of course though, sometimes an exceptionally skilled trainer would come and they managed to beat them.

It was just so... frustrating!

"Nhh... it's not fair!" she complained at the top of her lungs,
"It's unfair! That's what it is! I was supposed to win, not you! Ahhh!"

You and Leaf exchanged an awkward look. The giantess sure wasn't kidding when she said Whitney was childish...

As for the same Whitney, she wasn't going to accept defeat.

Sending a glare in Leaf's direction, she decided she wasn't going to allow this. She was still the gym leader, after all, and as such she had the right to demand a rematch, no?

However, when her gaze casually shifted on you as Leaf returned her Blastoise, Whitney obtained a wide smirk.

Perhaps not a traditional rematach, she thought to herself.

So, putting on a solemn expression, Whitney cleared her throat and approached her former opponent.

"A-hem," she said in a cutesy voice,
"You did well, challenger, you truly showed your immense skills as a Pokemon trainer."

Leaf smiled.

"But-!" Whitney said, pausing to give some dramatic tone to what she was going to say next,
"I'm not giving my gym badge yet!"

Leaf's smile faded.

"What!?" you exclaimed, indignant, jumping on your feet on her shoulder,
"She beat you fair and square, you've got to give her your badge! Those are the rules!"

Whitney glared in your direction.

"Oh, quiet you! It's my gym, I make the rules!" Whitney retorted, her childish self returning with great strength; then, adopting a solemn expression once more, Whitney placed her arms behind her back,
"Leaf did a decent job beating me. However, there was two of you here, so the challenge is incomplete!"

'Two of you'...?

But the only person aside from Leaf was...

"... Me?" you spoke, incredulous. Even Leaf looked surprised,
"I was just a spectator! What have I got to do with any of this?"

Whitney smirked mischievously.

"Oh, you'll find you have something to do, and that's taking me on yourself!" she said.

"What?" Leaf quietly said,
"What!?" you exclaimed in a much louder tone, though your stature didn't make your voice much louder than Leaf's,
"I have no Pokemon! How am I supposed to do that?" you asked, growing more irritated with this brat of a gym leader by the second.

"I wasn't talking about a Pokemon battle, you dummy." Whitney giggled in an admittedly cute manner that made Leaf groan on the inside,
"You're taking me on in person!"

"... You can't be serious."

"But I am! Don't worry, it'll be a simple game... well, simpler for me." Whitney said with a wink.

You looked at Leaf, who just shrugged, nearly causing you to fall off.

"And that would be...?" you wondered, not believing you were really going through with this.

"Me and you get on the opposite side of the field and I'll place you down; your job is to run all the way back here while I try to catch you. Simple, right?" Whitney explained.

Yeah, simple... if you were normal-sized! Like this, it was like you had to run across two football fields at once!

Seeing you weren't opposing, and neither was Leaf, Whitney continued,

"If you win, your friend gets the badge," she said, holding her badge out; then, she sent a smirk your way,
"But if I win, I get something too... you!" she squealed like a schoolgirl.

... Were gym leaders supposed to make demands? This was really, really getting on your nerves.

Once again, you looked at Leaf for consultation, discovering that she was staring back at you with an expression between one of determination and one of concern.

The choice was up to you.

You could simply decline, but... Leaf had helped you, so you guessed it was your moment to pay your debt to her.

"Fine." you sighed massively,
"I'll do it."

Once more, Whitney squealed, while Leaf wore a small smile on her face; one of her hands then traveled to you as she picked you off of her shoulder.

"Win." she whispered to you,
"For both me and you."

You nodded in response as you were handed to Whitney, who began walking to the opposite side of her gym, giggling in a girlish manner along the way.

"What're you laughing at?" you questioned.

"Oh." Whitney shot you a wolfish grin,
"Just thinking of all the fun we're going to have together."

Okay, now you officially had to win.

When Whitney finally reached the other end of the field, she did a silly pirouette and faced Leaf; then, as promised, she bent to let you down beside her running shoes, before she rose slightly, hands on her knees.

"Okay, I'll give you a - heh - small headstart. You have five seconds to get as far as you can before I come after you, and be warned that I'm not going to lose!" she said, rising back to her impressive, full height.

Then, she rose the five fingers of her left hand; getting the hint, you sprinted away, hearing Whitney's giggle as her thumb went down.

One after another, her fingers went down, with the pink-haired gym leader singing a countdown.

"One." she chirped, wasting no more time as she began running after you, who hadn't even cleared a quarter of the field.

Hearing booming footsteps behind you, you sped up.

This was when your 'challenge' began.
112321232221121313.title: Unofficial challenge

choices: Whitney refuses to give you the badge
Leaf talks to Whitney and comforts her
Whitney gives you the badge, but in exchange...
1123212322211213131.content:
It was a tough game, one that was pretty much designed to make sure you can’t win. You are suppose to run away from a girl, who can easily not only stay on your tail, but grab you. She has every advantage in this situation and you had none. As you run you could feel her footsteps behind, moving right after you.

You are not going to win this. You got to try though.

“Hehehe, look at you go. You are so cute when you run!” Whitney said with a giggle as she caught up to you, but just to toy with you she didn’t reach down yet. Her hands behind her back as she happily strolls. “When I get you, I can get like a Ratatta ball for you! It would look so adorable!”

You ignore the voice above and just keep running. So she simply just kept talking.

“Don’t worry, you are gonna love your new life with me. I will be super nice to you, I will let you sleep with me, and i’ll feed you sweets for breakfast and carry you around with me. Maybe in like a pocket, oh this pocket!” She said pointing to the pocket next to her chest. “You would look like super adorable there!”

You ignore her giant teasing words and just get running. You were barely one third of the way, and you could see Leaf with a worried expression. This was not looking good for her badge, or for you.

“Okay, time to win now!” She said confidently as she bent her giant body. Her fingers coming for you as Leaf held her breath. Was this going to be the end of it. That Gym battle was over, will she lose like that? She can challenge Whitney again, but you are gonna lose your freedom! Your life will belong to this pink haired gym leader! No choice of getting Mew. She closed her eyes though, a little bit scared. However once she heard no reaction she opened them up, seeing you... still running.

Whitney a bit confused as well. “H-Hey, get here!” She yelled as she brought her fingers to you, only for you to jump over it like a hurdle running once again. “What the hay, he’s faster!”

Leaf looked as well, seeing you were sprinting with your speed. It made no sense, you should be caught. She narrowed her eyes trying to get a better look at your face. Tired yes, but determined.

Why, well it was a mix of determination and adrenaline. You will make this.

“Stop running!” Whitney said as she reached for you, her fingers grabbing you but you quickly slip your way out of it. Whitney getting nothing as you run out of her reach. “Are you kidding me, stop it!” Whitney whined as she moved around.

She needed to stop this, so she moved around and put her foot at the halfway mark. Stomping her shoe knowing you won’t be able to run through it. Then she can just grab you.

You however moved and climbed over it, almost not stopping your momentum as she was left confused about it. She did not know why you were able to do this so easily.

She lost to Leaf, she will not lose to you. With a bit of an angry scream, she went to grab you. Only for you to get more determination and run even more.

“Y-You can do it! We can win this!” Leaf yelled above as you see the towering girl. She was so far, but with her cheering you on, you can do this!

No matter how much Whitney went to grab you, you dodged left and right. Strafing out of her reach. The one time she seemed to be able to get you, you quickly stopped and ran back. Running between her legs.

“Huh?” She questioned seeing you go behind and turning around. However when she did that you did a turn once again, going back to Leaf as you confused Whitney for a second. When she realised you were running the right way again, you did get some good distance.

“T-That’s no fair!” She whined as she moved ahead. If she can’t stop you, she will block you. She moved ahead of you and dropped her body. Just laying down as she smirked at you. No way you were gonna get past her.

She’s got it all. You have to climb her in order to get past, and she can grab you then. If you try to go above her head, she can get you there. She’s got you!

You saw this... and turned down. Simple as that as you ran by her feet. Running past it as she panicked.

“H-Hey! Don’t!” She yelled as she actually attempted to stomp on you! You move around though, and now you were on the homestretch to Leaf.

Leaf crouching down with her hands reaching for you, as well as Whitney chasing you aiming to grab you.

You just sprint with all your heart. Until you feel fingers wrap around you. You heart beat stops for a second as you try to figure out who’s fingers these were.

You get pulled forward, right into a hugging chest.

“You did it, you actually did it.” Leaf said as you look up to her. Smiling as you did it. Leaf was beyond happy about this as she held you tight. When she pulled out, she let you rest on her palm, and you needed a very good rest.

“Well, I have my Pokemon, and you to thank for this gym badge.” She said with a smile. She doesn’t expect a response, from all the running you ended up doing it is fair for you to rest.

“I... lost.” Whitney said. Leaf looked ahead at the gym leader, and dropped onto her knees. When suddenly tears began to pour. “Whahhhh!!!” She said, crying like a baby. Throwing Leaf off. never did she expect a gym leader to act like this?
1123212322211213131.title: Your Gym Battle With Whitney

choices: Leaf accepted and decided to stick around for a while longer
Leaf declined, wanting to get to Blackthorn City soon
11232123222112131312.content:
Seeing Whitney cry would have probably seemed hilarious to some people, heart-breaking to others, but to you and Leaf it was just plain awkward.

Neither of you didn't know what to do or say and just stood there, watching as the pink-haired gym leader wailed.

Finally, you spoke to your giant companion,

"Uhh... what should we do?" you asked. Leaf shrugged.
"Can't we just leave and come back later? Who knows, maybe she'll be better."

"Yeah, and ready to make another challenge." Leaf commented, looking at you,
"Not happening, pal."

You sighed, then looked back at Whitney.

"Then something tells me we're gonna be here for quite some time..." you muttered.

Leaf frowned.

"I'm not staying here five minutes longer." she declared, admittedly sick of Whitney's attitude.

Leaf mentally swore to herself that, once she got out of this gym, she would never ask its leader for a rematch.

So, gently placing you back on top of her shoulder, Leaf strolled towards Whitney, who was busily rubbing her eyes.

"Hey..." Leaf began, only to be targeted by a fiery glare sent from the pink-haired gym leader.

"What more do you want? Isn't it enough that you've beaten me twice, y-you-you-you... you meanies!"

Sheesh, what a drama queen.

Leaf remained deadpan.

"The badge."

Whitney didn't reply, but shot another glare. Clearly, she wasn't in the mood for being asked her badge.

"Ah, just what is wro-" you tried to speak, but were interrupted when Leaf drove her finger into your chest, poking and silencing you.

Then, the giantess got on her knees as well and placed a hand on Whitney's shoulder.

As much as she hated to do it, Leaf knew she had to comfort her former opponent, or she was never going to get out with the badge.

"Listen, before I came here, I was told that you were an exceptionally strong leader, and you really are," she said with that quiet voice of hers, a voice that you learned only ever rose whenever Leaf got really passionate about something,
"But you can't always win. Sometimes you'll lose, too."

As Leaf spoke soothingly, realization hit you - did the admittedly pretty gym leader act like this with every trainer that beat her?

Embarrassing...

Whitney sniffled.

"Says you!" she exclaimed, pointing a finger to Leaf,
"You just got lucky! I'd have completely trashed you if you weren't so lucky! It's so unfair!"

You sighed heavily.

"Yeah, I was probably a bit lucky," Leaf admitted,
"And my friend here was probably even luckier than I was-"

"Hey!" you grumbled, before muttering,
"That's the thanks I get for helping... I'll mind my own business next time."

"... Because you're a great trainer, but no one can always win. It's how life works. You just got to keep trying and show life that a few losses can't keep you down. That's the kind of person a trainer as strong as you is."

Whitney, who had remained silent, looked away; you were still a bit annoyed by Leaf's earlier comment about your luck, but were also shocked to hear her speech. It was the kind of speech a big sister would give, sweet and encouraging at the same time.

This was a side of Leaf you had not seen so far, a side far from the teasing one she showed when you were around.

In the end, Leaf offered her hand with a smile; Whitney blushed, realizing the tantrum she had thrown over no reason. But, she couldn't help it. She hated losing.

Gingerly, she accepted Leaf's hand and the two stood up.

"You're right..." Whitney admitted, accurately averting Leaf's gaze,
"You're a super strong trainer, and your friend over there is quite a runner..." she praised, winking at you.

You blushed, wondering how could she be back to teasing already.

"So, since you... defeated... me twice, you can have the Plain Badge." Whitney finished, digging in a pocket, picking out her badge, placing it on Leaf's awaiting hand; with a smile, your caretaker promptly put it away lest Whitney changed her mind and whispered,
"Thanks."

After that, Leaf turned around and began heading out, her hand rising as she waved goodbye.

However, Whitney didn't respond, but shot you a glance and sighed.

The fun she would have had with you...

--

"Finally!" you yelled one you were outside, away from the moody gym leader,
"I was starting to think we were going to spend the night in her gym!"

Leaf giggled.

"You're too pessimistic." she replied.

"Said miss 'I'm not staying here five minutes longer'." you retorted playfully.

Leaf gained a blush and didn't reply.

"...So, what are we doing next?" you asked,
"You mentioned you wanted to get a back, right?"

Leaf's eyes lit up.

"Oh, that's right." she said,
"But I also need to head to the Pokemon Center to have my team healed."

"Hey, after that, do you think we could stick around, at least for a bit?" you asked, looking around.

You hadn't gotten out of Olivine City much, so you were pleasantly surprised to see new places, even if in a dire situation such as yours,
"It's pretty here."

Leaf halted.

"I don't know, I want to get my last badge soon." she said,
"And then we can focus on finding Mew."

"Aw, c'mon. We can just take a walk around and then we can leave," you suggested, though your mind was screaming you that finding Mew was a priority; you shushed the voice. Being this small couldn't keep you from having some fun, right?

Leaf looked at you and pondered the suggestion.
11232123222112131312.title: Challenge complete!

choices: Fun with Ninetails
Fun with Chikorita
Fun With Dragonite
All three
112321232221121313121.content:
“Fine, we can stay here for one more night. After all, I have many things I need to do in the city. Get a bike, checkout the daycare!”

“Great! Plus, we really should be inside tonight rather than camp outside.” You say to her as she gave you a confused look. “B-Because it would be much safer.”

“I’m not in danger.” She said to you. “And if we get attacked by Pokemon, I can fend them off.”

“Yeah but... you know.” You say to her as truly she didn’t know. She didn’t fully piece together what you were trying to insinuate, until she thought about it some more.

“Wait a second, you have camped outside before.”

“Okay, If I got to say it, no! I have never done that, not even once.” You say defending yourself. Truthfully, she was a bit thrown off about it, but she still wore a smile on her face.

“It’s fine, but we are gonna do it tomorrow night. It’s a long trip to the next city.” She said with a smile, moving around.

“Hehe, who knows, we might find Mew!” You say joking about it, as she was looking at you a bit sad. That plan of yours is still there, and she was hoping you were going to be over it.

She ignored it and moved ahead, going to the centre.

-

“Can I out now?” You question her.

“Not yet, i’ll tell you when.” She said walking to her room. You being thrown around inside of her bag hitting her Pokeballs, her berries and pretty much everything you can.

“Okay, you can come out.” She said finally, pulling you out as you get grabbed. Brought right to her face as you see a room, much like the last one.

“Is this the same Pokecenter in Olivine City?” You joke to her.

“All Pokemon centres are the same, region based at least. I heard that they switch them up every now and then.”

“That’s unique.” You say to her as she couldn’t help but smile a bit.

“If you think that’s unique, you should of seen this Nurse Joy. Just like the other one.” She joked moving over to her bed. “My Pokemon are healed though, and I think it’s fair that they can come out. I even got the extended suite for them.”

You turn your head around, seeing the giant extension made for Pokemon.

“Cool, wait does that mean i’m going to-”

“See my Pokemon again, yes. Don’t worry you are going to be safe with Ninetails, and Chikorita does feel bad.” She said as you were glad hearing that. “Plus, as a reward they can see you.”

“Right... what about the other two?” You question just wanting to know.

“Well, Dragonite has to stay, the next gym is Dragon but I do think I am going to switch out Blastoise.”

“Switch him out? Why? That Pokemon won you the last match.” You say to her as she smirks.

“He did, but I can’t keep relying on that. I’ve had him fight in every gym. I need to switch it up. Even at the cost of a lost.”

“R-Right. Well who you are going to get?” You question Leaf interested as she dropped you onto the bed.

“Well, I’ve heard that she uses five Pokemon, and considering this is the last badge for me in this region, maybe even six. So I am going to get three more my reserves.”

“Okay, which ones are they?” You say as she thought about it.

“I have a Dewgong, she’s pretty powerful and an Ice Type would be powerful against her dragons.” Leaf said as she gave it some real thought about it. Really glad as she was going to continue. “I’ve heard that she has a Kingdra. A Flaaffy might be able to face that Pokemon, although I am going to have to train that Flaffy. As for the last one, well I haven’t decided. I’m going to the PC right now to transfer.”

“Great!” You say with a smile as you were optimistic about her life. That was not going to remain, cause she smiled on her face going around. She went over and grabbed her Pokeballs, and your excitement went to worry.

“Come on out you three!” She said tossing it. Right down to the ground as you see all three come. The Leaf starter, the fox Pokemon and the giant dragon. All three of them into the extended area.

“Okay you three!” Leaf said with a smile. “I’ve got to get the rest of the team, you just stay here and he’s in charge!” She said pointing right at you on the bed. All three of the Pokemon looking at you, two of them smiling and you were unsure of Dragonite. That’s the only Pokemon you have not really met. If you were being honest you don’t even know it’s gender.

“Great, just give away my position. That’s exciting.” You say to her as she laughs about it finding it more than just a bit funny.

“Relax, they won’t hurt you. I’ll be back soon with more Pokemon.” And with that she left. Truth be told you thought that three were more than enough but you didn’t choose.

You look up to all three of them backing up and unsure of what you are going to do. “H-Hey. Good job today.”

“Oh, coming back aren’t you.” Ninetails said. “It’s like you can’t keep away from me.”

“No fair, you had him last time! It’s my turn to have him!” Chikorita complained as the giant Dragon spoke up.

“Who is he? Why is he so small?” It tilted it’s head.

“Oh right, you haven’t met him yet. He’s been staying with Leaf since the last gym! Mew shrunk him!”

“And now he is here for us. You two best not get involved in the matter. I want him alone with me.” Ninetails as all three of them get interested about it.
112321232221121313121.title: Leaf Switching Out Her Team

choices: Leaf decided to call it a day
Leaf decided to go out for a while; obviously, you're going along
1123212322211213131214.content:
Chikorita immediately shot Ninetales a glare at the declaration.

"Dream on!" she exclaimed, irritated; Ninetales had been hogging you in the morning, no way Chikorita was going to let it happen again!
"You've had him the whole morning, it's my turn now!"

In response, Ninetales only moved forward and swiftly leaped on the bed Leaf was supposed to sleep in, leaning very close to you who, albeit intimidated, stood still. After all, the golden fox had been gentle to you in the morning.

"Hey, Ninetales..." you saluted; in response, the vixen leaned in and, crying her name softly, she placed her head into your lap... or, at least, she tried, because when she did, you were pushed on your back with the head of a giant Pokemon laying atop your body.

The Pokemon giantess giggled softly. She didn't mind that position and, judging from your lack of movement, you either didn't as well or you couldn't move, both of which made the vixen quite happy.

Unlike another Pokemon in the room.

With a growl, Chikorita left a still confused Dragonite behind and rushed to the vixen who, much like she had done earlier, formed a barrier by merely raising her tails, blocking the younger Pokemon entirely.

"Sorry darling, losers weepers. " Ninetales mocked playfully, referring to Chikorita's earlier defeat against a certain Girafarig; with even more tails to deal with than the last time, Chikorita let out a frustrated growl.

"C-Chikoo!" she complained as, each move she made, Ninetales shifted her tails, blocking any attempt of Chikorita's to at least catch a glimpse of you.

In the meantime, you were being nuzzled by a huge fox and noticed nothing, although, even if you did notice, you would have probably done nothing anyway; Chikorita still had a long way to go to regain your trust.

Ninetales kept cuddling you for some more time while keeping Chikorita away; then, a mischievous idea popped in the head of the vixen.

After all, Dragonite hadn't met you yet, and she was just 'keeping you safe from Chikorita'.

So, leaning in to you after briefly rising her head, Ninetales whispered,

"Sorry sweetie, our time is up. "

Then, one of her tails departed from the others, allowing Chikorita to get past the barrier; however, the same tail slid under you and rose you up before the green Pokemon could swipe you away.

"Hey, Dragonite," Ninetales called to the third Pokemon that was in the room, who hadn't made a move since she found out about you; she would have liked to play with you as well, but she was pretty big and feared she would hurt you.

Dragonite sighed.

This was one of the times she regretted evolving from Dragonair, back when she had a slim, elegant and beautiful figure.

Ninetales' snapped her out of the world of memories,

"Catch."

"Huh?"

The next moment was very fast, and yet seemingly endless to you; Ninetales suddenly flipped her tail, which acted as a catapult and tossed you towards Dragonite, so fast that you nearly didn't notice when the dragon caught you.

When you finally recovered from the overwhelming nausea, you noted that you were sitting on a somewhat rough surface and slowly looked up, noticing the Dragonite from before smiling down at you.

Your heart missed a beat: this beast was so immense compared to you that you feared a single squeeze of her claws would end you.

Luckily, she didn't seem to be harboring any malice.

"Dra." she said, 'Hello'.

"H-Hi, Dragonite..." you replied, before hastily crying,
"Be careful, please!"

Dragonite smiled gently and moved a claw over your back, beginning to stroke you as gently as she could, trying to reassure you.

"Yeah, you've introduced yourselves, now give him here!" Chikorita cried, now running to Dragonite, not immediately realizing the huge size difference.

Dragonite shot a glance in Ninetales' direction, discovering her staring with a smirk; returning the smirk, Dragonite looked down at Chikorita, who had gripped on of the dragon's legs.

Laughing, Dragonite lazily flapped her wings and began fluttering, with a now agitated Chikorita fighting not to fall.

"D-Dragonite!"

Dragonite only smiled, then looked at you and... tossed you. High.

Before you could scream, Dragonite did a quick spin in mid-air and threw off Chikorita as well, tossing her up too, before the dragon caught the two of you on her back.

Dragonite then began flying around with her 'passengers' on her back; it felt thrilling, like a rollercoaster ride, though you would have enjoyed it more if you weren't busy worrying about Chikorita, whom you were sharing the ride with.

You made sure to put some distance between you and her, but as it turned out, it was completely pointless, since the green Pokemon simply moved over to you and used a paw to pin you to her stomach as she held onto Dragonite with the other.

In all of this, Ninetales simply watched with a satisfied smile; sure, she may have said she wanted you for herself, but Dragonite was a good teammate who hadn't had the opportunity to meet you; however, Ninetales still made a mental note to make up for lost time the next time she had the chance.

The flight lasted a while more, with Dragonite growing more bold in her acrobatics, resulting in you having to hold on to Chikorita, who held on to the dragon; eventually though, the fun stopped.

The door opened and in came Leaf, three Pokeballs in hand; the sight that came to her eyes made her smile.

"Ah, I see you're having fun."

Immediately, Dragonite stopped and, letting out a happy cry, landed, letting Chikorita snatch you up and jump down whole crying her name excitedly; even you had to admit that the experience was a lot of fun.

Leaf sighed.

"Chikorita, bring him to me." she ordered and, albeit very reluctantly, Chikorita picked you by the scruff of your shirt and carried you to Leaf, gently letting you onto her awaiting hand before retreating to where Ninetales and Dragonite were.

You turned to Leaf.

"So... are you done?"

The giantess nodded her head, then tossed her Pokeballs, out of which came a Dewgong and a Flaaffy, just as promised; the third one was a...

"... Wigglytuff?" you asked, noting a large pink and white bunny going to greet her friends; Leaf nodded.

"She was one of the Pokemon I had back in Kanto." she explained, heading to her bed and collapsing on it, letting out a tired sigh,
"As a fairy-type, she's going to be a great advantage against the gym leader's dragon-types, whoever they are."

"... Aren't you going to introduce me to your Pokemon?"

Leaf shook her head.

"I'm beat. That, and Chikorita's probably on the job already." she said, moving the hand you were on to her stomach, dropping you on it; then, you watched as Leaf took off her hat and placed it on her face, groaning.

"You look exhausted." you unnecessarily pointed out.

The giantess' voice came muffled from under her hat, making it even harder for her to be heard,

"That Whitney girl wore me out... in more than one way." she said.

You were reminded of your earlier 'challenge' against Whitney.

"... You're telling me that."

Leaf sighed and took the hat off of her face.

"Next time I have to battle someone like her, I'm just going to steal the badge and get away." she said.

You laughed.

"But that's wrong, isn't it?" you rhetorically asked.

In response, Leaf shot you a smirk.

"Why? That's how I got my Squirtle to begin with." she said.

You stopped laughing, not sure how to react to that.

"Ehh..."

"Long story. Too tired." Leaf quickly dismissed you, though she smiled as she remembered some of her adventures back in Kanto that led her to meet Red.

"O-kay?" you hesitated. Seriously, this girl seemed to become more mysterious the more time you spent with her.

"So, um... what now?" you asked her, deciding to drop the subject and move on to another one.
"I think it's a bit early to just go to sleep, what do you think?"

Leaf looked up, pensive.

There was still some time left before bedtime, she mused, and perhaps she could use that time to go out for a while, check out the bike shop and catch some dinner... also, that would also give her the opportunity to spend some time with you without her Pokemon, who she could just leave here.

But she was also very tired right now...
1123212322211213131214.title: Yet another playtime...

choices: They all start to play keep away with you
Just a big cuddle fest
Wigglytuff puts all the others to sleep with Sing!
11232123222112131312141.content:
Although Leaf was feeling a bit tired, she would rather go to sleep then stay up at the moment. She just dealt with the most frustrating gym leader yet and she wanted to rest at the moment. So moving around and getting back, she laid on the bed and got off her shoes.

“Sorry, but i’m going to sleep. If we go to sleep early, we can hopefully be out of this town with all our business early.” She said as you guess that made sense.

“Sucks, i’m still feeling like doing something. S-” You trailed off, as you turn your head and look around. You turn as you see her reaching her shirt and taking it off. “Wait a second, your changing here!?”

“I’ll cover myself with the blanket. Relax.” She joked as you guess that was what was happening. With a smile on her face she continued, while you started to question her.

“Isn’t that a bit... too open?” You say as she looks at you.

“If you don’t look, I have my top off right now.”

Yeah, you are not gonna risk it and look. No matter how great the sight would be. You just wait there in an awkward silence, until finally she told you can turn around, now in her nightwear.

“So what were you saying?” She questioned. You look at her for a couple of seconds.

“I’m still a bit awake, sucks we are going to sleep.”

“We? You don’t have to if you don’t want to. I’m not forcing you.” She said laying her head on the pillow.

“Yeah but... you know. With you asleep i’ll be board on the bed.” You tell her as she simply replies.

“You don’t have to stay on the bed. Go play with my Pokemon.” She said as you look at her for a couple of seconds. Really confused about what she was saying.

“That’s... very unsafe. I need you to get them in line and, by the looks of it they are conspiring against me.” You say as you turn your head and see the six Pokemon, all of them in a group and Chikorita barking her name at them. Probably telling them about you. You were getting a bunch of glances from them, every now and then.

“You said you were board, it’s either sleep or them.” She said as you look back and forth so much. Sitting on the fence a bit as Leaf didn’t have time for this. “If you are not gonna make the choice, then I will make it for you.” With that, she brought her fingers around and grabbed you.

“H-Hey?” You say freaking out, as she brought you down to the ground! She brought you down to the ground and you see her giant face looming over the bed.

“Goodnight.”

“W-Wait a second, you are not about to leave me be, right? Your joking?” You question her hoping, but she just moved her face away from view and

*Click*

Turned off the lights. Well to this part of the place. The Pokemon extension was still well lit for them. You look to the ground of Pokemon. They all noticed that Leaf went to sleep, and you are guessing by that guess the figured you were with them. You were kind of hiding in the dark beside the bed.

“Oh, why not.” You say just giving in. You force your legs to move forward, stepping forward and getting up to the giant Pokemon. You walk to the group, as you see them get bigger and bigger as you get closer to the horizon. Finally you were under and all of them noticed.

“Chiko!” She cheered. Your favourite grass type jumping it’s way forward and coming down to you. Laying on it’s stomach as you laugh.

“Hey there Chikorita.” You say to her moving your small hand and tapping her nose playfully. Mind if I talk to the group?” You question her as she nodded. Dropping her head and on her leaf. “Y-You want me to... okay.” You say as you step onto the leaf.

Like a burger, she flipped you with her leaf. Flipping you around and letting you get onto the head. It was a little weird, but it was fine as the Pokemon turned.

You look ahead and all the Pokemon were looking at you! Not only the new ones, but the old ones as well. How awkward was this.

“Uh... hi. Sure Chikorita told you three about me.” You say to the new Pokemon. “I’m (Your Name).”

“Flaaffy!” The electric type cheered, seeming to like you.

“Dewgong?” The water ice type said tilting it’s head, almost like she still didn’t believe what she was seeing.

“Wigglytuff.” The fairy type puffed. Pouting a bit. She didn’t seem that happy with you? What did you do?

“Yeah, please to meet you. Well, Leaf has gone to sleep, and... i’m still up to play with you all.” You say sending them a smile.

All the Pokemon seemed excited for this, except for Wigglytuff who didn’t look anymore happy about it? Did this Fairy type not like you.

“Hehe, you got kicked out of the bed!”

“No, I didn’t get kicked out of the bed Chikori- Hey!” You say freaking out as you suddenly feel a force jump and tackle you. You feel yourself, getting rubbed against something soft. Wool?

“Hi there!” The Flaffy said, as it continued to hug you. She seems to really like you, and oh boy was it soft.

As you two were having fun, Chikorita was left stunned. “W-Wait, did he know what I said?” She said bewildered. Most of the Pokemon didn’t notice, not even you. She did though.

“I’ve heard,” Ninetails says walking past. “That Pokemon and Humans with strong enough bonds can break through the language, and understand each other through emotions.”

“I-Is that what happened? Is my bond with him that strong.”

“No of course not, you are just crazy.”

“Hey!”

What happens next?
11232123222112131312141.title: Leaf Takes You Off The Bed

choices: Leaf returned to the Pokemon Center
Along the way, Leaf was stopped by someone... Whitney again!?
11232123222112131312142.content:
Leaf shook her head, then sent a smile in your direction; you were right, there was still some time before she could call it a day, and she definitely felt she could stay up for a while longer to explore around a bit.

After all, the main reason she was traveling in Johto was to have fun, and Goldenrod City was supposed to be one of the greatest places in the region from what she had heard.

"You know what? Let's do it," Leaf spoke, adopting a slight blush,
"I owe you after all,"

"You... do?" you questioned. The giantess giggled and nodded.

"Yeah, you won me the badge, remember?" she pointed out, moving to grab you from her stomach before sitting up.

"Hehe... I owed you that, you know..."

"And you deserve a reward for it. Plus," Leaf said,
"I really want to check the bike shop out, then I'll get us some dinner. How does that sound?"

"Sounds fun!" you replied, causing the giantess to giggle once more.

Carefully holding you, Leaf got up and picked the keys of the room she had rented before walking to the door; when she reached it, she stopped to look at her Pokemon.

She wasn't scared of leaving them alone: her loyal companions were strong enough to look out for themselves. Still...

"I'm heading out for a while," she announced,
"I've, uh, got something to do. No fighting, okay? Save that for the battlefield."

Leaf's Pokemon cried their names in response, though before the trainer could leave, one of them ran towards her.

Obviously, it was...

"Chikorita." Leaf quietly spoke as the grass-type stopped in front of her, smiling up to her.

"Chi-Chiko!" she cried happily.

"I'm guessing she wants to tag along," you said, Chikorita smiling in your direction and nodding her head.

Leaf sighed.

"Fine." she conceded, gesturing for Chikorita to follow as she headed out with you in hand; Chikorita happily obeyed, though not before having turned to shoot Ninetales one last, smug look.

The golden-furred vixen replied by turned her back to Chikorita, giving an annoyed flip of her tails, before she disappeared from sight as Leaf closed and locked the door.

--

The sun hadn't set yet, but it wasn't long until then, and the lights in Goldenrod were already lit; a gentle breeze blew past you as you sat onto Leaf's shoulder while she walked through the streets with Chikorita happily trotting beside her.

"It's pretty here," Leaf commented at some point, looking around: there were people happily chatting or simply walking.

"It is," you agreed, before asking,
"So, what do you want to check out, first? I know there's a huge department store in this city."

"Tempting." Leaf replied with a smile,
"But I told you, I want to check the bike shop, first."

"The lady makes the call, Leaf," you joked, causing her to giggle. She liked this, she liked your company, though she was never going to admit it; beside her, Chikorita pouted, jealous.

It took a while, but Leaf eventually found the shop she was searching for, hid you in her hat like earlier for good measure and entered; within ten minutes, Leaf got out of the store with a new bike that had a little basket that was meant for you to ride in.

The giantess took off her hat, only to place you right in the basket as she mounted her new bike.

"So, what do you think?" she asked with a smile.

"Hehe, it's cool," you said, leaning back,
"It's gonna be great, traveling like this."

"Heh, glad you think that," Leaf replied, before smirking,
"Now, make way for your new roomie..."

Before you could even think what she meant by that, a certain green Pokemon excitedly climbed her way onto the bike as fast as a lightning and jumped into the basket along with you, nearly squashing you.

"Chikorita, be more careful!" you cried, frightened, causing the green behemoth to giggle; since you got Leaf's help, you began forgetting how much more fragile you were from time to time, and Chikorita seemed intent on reminding you of that every time.

Leaf watched both her Pokemon and her small friend together in the basket and couldn't but think that the scene was pretty adorable.

It was only a moment, though.

"Okay you, two let's put this bike to the test," she whispered. Then, without any kind of warning, she began peddling.

--

Leaf rode her new bike around the city for a while, enjoying every second of it, having missed the feeling of the speed and the wind in her hair. It was such a good sensation, the feeling of true freedom!

As for you, you were once again forced to hold on to Chikorita as Leaf rode too fast for your likings.

Eventually though, the trainer stopped in front of a large building that, according to a sign nearby, was the Radio Tower of Goldenrod.

"That was fun," Leaf commented. Chikorita cheered in agreement, having enjoyed the ride very much... and the fact that you were stuck with her even more.

"Yeah," you agreed as well, poking your head out of the basket to face Leaf,
"I think we'll get to Blackthorn City in no time now, haha!"

Leaf nodded in response, agreeing with you.

Then, you saw her looking at the sky: the sun had settled a while ago, but she didn't seem to notice.

"We should head back," she said, turning to you,
"I'll pick something for us to eat on the way, what do you say?"

"I'm okay with that."
"Ta."
"And Chikorita's too."

With a giggle, Leaf nodded her head and prepared to ride the way back to the Pokemon Center; you once more grabbed onto Chikorita, who just cooed her name in delight.
11232123222112131312142.title: Goldenrod night

choices: She saw you as a bug and tries to crush you
She correctly identifies you as human and tries to help you
11233.content:
You proved to be indecisive when Leaf casually passed you by and walked out of the gym satisfied with her new badge. Just like that, one of the doors of opportunity that were wide open for you had closed, much like the automatic doors of Jasmine’s gym.

You felt yourself collapse to your knees as you started down at the floor with despair in your eyes when you realized that your winning odds had decreased drastically. While you still had Jasmine as an option, it would’ve helped out so much to call out to Leaf as well. Having multiple options is way better than having one disappear forever. What a blunder.

But hey, look at the bright side: you still had Jasmine, and she would definitely help you out if you were to ask her. She really is just that kind. So maybe there is still hope for you after all.

“Chi....chika?” Chikorita spoke sounding confused. Your head shot back up immediately when you hear the sound.

It seems that Chikorita was still here inside the gym for some reason. Did she lock herself in by not going through the automatic doors fast enough? But that doesn’t make sense since the doors should work for pokemon too, so what’s the deal?

“Chika?” Chikorita cries again now with more curiosity. You didn’t have a clue what she was curious about. If anything, you should be curious about why she was still here. That was until you realized who she was speaking too.

“........m-me?” You said pointing to yourself, which only piqued her interest. You had now realized that Chikorita was starting at you, unable to understand what she was seeing. You felt yourself starting to get cold sweat while Leaf went back into the gym when she also realized Chikorita didn’t follow her.

“Hey Chikorita, you can’t stay behind like that, we need to get to the next gym.” Leaf said gently to Chikorita as she kept starting at you. “Is something the matter?” Jasmine asked checking to see if something was wrong. “No nothing, Chikorita just gets distracted easily. Come on girl, let’s go.” Leaf said not thinking much of her behavior. At least you now you know that her trusty companion was female.

“Chika!” she cried out before running into your direction. You have been spotted! You instantly fell into a panic as you quickly scrabbled for a way to escape. You first tried to run into the open but you got halted when Chikorita leaped in front of you to block your path and that was all she wrote when you quickly found yourself cornered, as she slowly kept walking to you closer and closer.

“Hey! What are you doing?” Leaf said, with it being her turn to be confused. “I’ll see if i can help.” Jasmine responded to the commotion. You reckoned that she was coming here as well since you could feel the ground shaking with each step she took. Not that it matters right now, you need to keep eye on the most immediate threat!

Looks like you didn’t think too much about what you were going to do if had gotten the attention of someone since you were cowering in fear when faced with one. While normally cute looking, due to the size differences, Chikorita’s presences became intimidating and bone chillingly scary up close as she looked down at your small body. You held tightly onto your heart as you felt the green titan coming closer and cornering you even further. Is this really it? The end? You didn’t even come close to finding Mew and your journey ends here along with your life?!

Left without any options, you just sat there, staring at the Chikorita that was going to decide your fate. In the end....
11233.title: Sudden encounter!

choices: Decided to head to the town first
Ventured back into the grass to retrieve your stuff
Went into the same direction as Mew
Felt a presence behind you
Just kept pondering some more (more options)
12.content:
It began to really dawn on you how insane this situation has become. Simple games of harmless fun have ended up with you no taller than a single blade of grass. Anyone could crush you without them ever knowing, the extent of your options was almost nonexistent and even if you were to be discovered, things could get even more sour if they were to see you as a bug.

You were convinced that Mew knew that you had to deal with all of these problems when she had shrunk you when you remembered her saying ”Come find me!”. She must have known how ridiculously impossible living like this was going to be when she made herself the only method to end it.

So why did she do this to you? Was this some kind of test? At least it would somewhat justify all of this if this was the “Prove your worth by reaching me” sort of thing. Otherwise, this was going to be the worst game of hide and seek you ever had the misfortune of playing.

The rotting feeling of despair then slowly began to build inside of you. There was simply no way you were able to find Mew. Finding her at normal size would be near to impossible on it’s own let alone as the size of an ant. An already massive world has become massive-er, and how would you even begin traversing it and finding her. She might already be out of the Sinnoh region and at the other side of the earth for all you know, so you might as well stay put and get used to living as a few inches tall. It’s the best option you have anyway....

.....no, that cannot be the case. Something just felt wrong with leaving things like that, never getting to explore and witness the wonders waiting out there to be discovered and seen. You couldn’t let that happen, you had to give it everything you got to make sure that doesn’t happen. Maybe this is what Mew is trying to test you for; your determination to go through thick and thin in order to reach your goal. Yeah, that’s got to be it!

.....hopefully.

Anyway, with this new found hope, you quickly began to look for a way to get out of the jungle of grass you were in since you couldn’t see well if someone was coming near you or not. You would then either miss your chance to get the attention of someone passing by or get crushed in a truly pathetic manner. Either way, you now know what you need to do: you’re going to find Mew!

Eventually you reached a rock extending even higher up than the grass. The surface was fortunately rough enough to allow you to climb it up and reach higher altitude. This would fix both issues of being completely unnoticeable inside the grass as well as your lack of vision, killing two bird with one stone.

Cheesy pun aside, after some scaling, you finally managed to get on top of the rock. Along with giving you a better perspective of the forest you were also able to make out the town you were near: Sandgem Town. Now you remembered that you came to this forest in the first place to look for more pokemon to add to your team after you got your starter from Professor Rowan. Funny isn’t it? After making your first step into your journey as a pokemon trainer, it was abruptly halted with a playful Mew shrinking you for whatever reason.

....oh wait, that’s it! You could use you pokemon to traverse through this dangerous world. Then you wouldn’t be as valuable as you are now, so all you need to do is....huh? Where’s your pokeball?

You panicked as you realized that your pokeball that contained your pokeman was no longer in your pocket, same with your Pokenav. You must have dropped inside the grass, though you weren’t sure whether it was before or after you were shrunk. Just fantastic either way.

So what now? You could either go back inside the grass to go looking for your stuff or first get some help from the townsfolk. You didn’t know how you were going to do it but it would definitely improve your odds if you managed to. Then again, anything could happen while you were in this state, so maybe it was best to go prepared.

As you were pondering with this dilemma for what your first play was going to be, you...
12.title: Start from square one

choices: You press the button and bring out Turtwig
You press the button and bring out Chimchar
You press the button and bring out Piplup
You press the button and bring out (Your Choice)
You don't and you are at the mercy of Shinx
124.content:
As you go around, planning to simply walk down and look for your giant Pokeball, you get stopped.

Not by anything physically, but by a feeling you had. That you were being watched, and that eyes were on you.

It got even worse, when you could actually hear the loud sound of something rustling behind you. Scared, you knew you had to look and see what it was. You do the slowest turn you could, as you see a giant figure on the outskirts of the tall grass. With it’s eyes right on you.

A blue body, four legged electric type, who has used it’s keen eyes to spot you.

“Shinx...” It said, as it was looking right at you. This was not good, you don’t know what this Pokemon wants but it sees you.

A wild Pokemon sees you. You try to hold your own on the rock, but that became more difficult as the Pokemon moved it’s way closer to you. It stepped on the grass, and you could see the grass you were in get knocked down and trampled on by it’s paws. That grass was like a forest to you, and this Pokemon simply walked it’s way through.

It got really close to you, to the point where it’s face was covering most of your sight. You two just look at each other for a long while.

Until finally, the giant behemoth of a Pokemon opened its Maw. Your eyes go wide, seeing it’s sharp teeth.

This Pokemon most people would say is cute, is giant to you! Even worse, it’s looking to eat you.

“Shiii!!!” It said moving it’s head forward. You acted quick. jumping out of the way from the Pokemon. Dodging it’s attack and off the rock. Hitting the ground, you slid down on some grass as it soften your fall a lot.

That was too close, why did that Shinx try eating you.

“Shinx?” It questioned, as you could hear it climb the rock and survey the land. Looking around for where you went. Seeing the giant electric type perched, you slowly move under the grass.

Making sure you were out of view before the Pokemon could find you. Thankfully you had a lot of cover, so it was not an easy job for the Pokemon to find you.

You could see it though, and it seemed to be looking at you very interestedly. To the point where you were a little bit worried at the moment. All you have to do is hide and make sure you were not going to be found. The Pokemon will lose interest before then.

That was your first plan, but you came across a better one... cause through the grass, you could see a bit of red.

Your eyes open as you realise that was your Pokeball! If you go and bring out your Pokemon, they can fight this Shinx! They can protect you!

With a smile you run over and plan to get real close to the ball. Still making sure you were not going to be found through the grass.

You got to it and... well it was too big. You couldn’t even fathom that you use to carry around this giant ball. It was so big, to the point where you could easily climb it.

Which turns out was something you had to do, cause the little button in the middle was far above the ground. Since that was how to open it, well you got to go.

Moving ahead and getting close, you start scaling the ball. It was smooth, but you were determined so you climbed it without little effort. Getting to the button, until another problem arrived.

You couldn’t... press the button. “Come on! Come on get pressed! I need you right now...”

“...Shinx...” The Pokemon said as you turn your head, seeing it looking at the ball, and a smile on it’s face. “Shinx!”

“I need you right now!” You say pushing with all your strength. Trying to get your Pokemon out, as Shinx wanted to get you to. The Pokemon leaped it’s way off the grass, trampling all the tree size grass that was under you. You were so small you had to make your under them, Shinx was just going to make her way through.

Like a towering goliath making her way to you. You close your eyes and coward, a little afraid as you just keep pushing the button with everything you have.

Either you were gonna get your Pokemon out, or you were a goner!

As the Pokemon made it’s final way to the grass, it saw that you were stuck to the ball. Now Shinx was a young Pokemon, and it didn’t know that you were trying to call a Pokemon. Instead it just thought you were stuck.

You see it come close, until finally it’s face was basically right behind you. Turning your head, you see the frightening side, until finally... it moved it’s nose to your back, almost pushing the button in when it pushed you in.

“Ah, okay. Come out now!” You say as you did not want this. The Shinx was treating you like a plaything. At normal size, at least you could deal with this Pokemon. At your size, you were at it’s mercy.

Even worse, you were at it’s face.

“Shinx!” It cheered, almost defeaning you as it seemed to like that you were stuck. You weren’t going to run anymore, and it was going to have food.

You see right down it’s throat as you could it’s teeth, it’s tongue and everything else in there.

“H-Hey!” You say trying to kick the Pokemon back. Trying to get it to back up and get away from you. The Pokemon was not caring though, as it planned to eat you.

With strength now backed by fear, you take one final weak push on the button. Knowing if you don’t get a Pokemon out right then... you were a goner.

What happens?
124.title: Your Encounter With A Shinx

choices: The Shinx is done playing, and it's hungry.
The Shinx is wants to play with you more.
The Shinx is done playing, and wants pets.
1245.content:
You press on the button as hard as you can, but it's no use. The device just cannot detect your minuscule amount of pressure. You're too small! You make an audible cry of defeat, as you know your fate was sealed.

And like a scripted play, you feel the Shinx's mouth envelope your legs, as you are dragged off of the Pokeball. You try to cling onto it, but its slippery surface doesn't give you much of a grip. You feel your body sink down into the maw, but stop right when your head reaches the Shinx's lips. You feel its tongue pressing on your whole body, soaking your clothes with its saliva.

"Shmmm," You hear the Pokemon hum. It then begins to walk off somewhere, jumping over the Pokeball with ease. You try to shimmy your way out of the mouth through the small entrance that allows your head to see outside, but the pressure of the tongue on you doesn't allow you to even move.

Why hasn't the Shinx eaten me though? That thought repeats through your head. The Shinx seemed so adamant on eating you before, why wont it eat you now. Maybe it wants to savor your taste? And where is it taking you anyways?

The last answer is swiftly answered, as the Shinx stops at an open field surrounded by bushes. There, it lowers its head and lets you out of their mouth. You land face first onto the dirt. Couldn't the Shinx let me out softer at least, you complain to yourself, getting yourself off of the ground.

"Shiiii!" The Shinx calls out in excitement behind you. You turn around to see the Shinx's giant form towering over you. You can tell by their body language, the way that the Pokemon's backside is raised in the air with their tail wagging, means that they want to play with you. If you tried to play with the giant, you'd surely be crushed by it, whether on purpose or accident. You try to slowly back away, but even that makes the Shinx jump at you.

The Shinx's paws land right in front of you, causing you to lose your balance and land on your back. You are now in direct eyesight of the Shinx again, this time with them looking down at you.

"Shinx! The Pokemon's booming voice says cheerfully, as they lift a paw over you. They easily pin you down, but luckily for you, the Shinx does it lightly, though enough for you to not escape. It then quickly lets go of you and jumps back. Is it playing with me?

You get yourself back up from the ground again, and walk slowly to the Shinx. It surprising stays still for you to get very close to it, as you touch its lowered nose.

"Shii..." It then makes a soft noise, telling you that...
1245.title: Playtime

choices: The Shinx's trainer. (Female)
The Shinx's trainer. (Male)
The Shinx's Family
A wild Pokemon
12453.content:
"Shinx..." The Shinx drops the rest of their body body to the ground, causing the dirt around it to blow you back. The Shinx looks at you with their playful golden eyes, waiting for you to do something. You decide to try to get close to the Pokemon again, holding out one of your hands towards its ruby red nose. The Shinx this time presses its fluffy cheek right on you, putting the weight of their whole head right on you.

Surprisingly, it didn't hurt you, well not dramatically. You did still feel discomfort when your back got slammed to the dirt by the wall of light blue fluff, but the fur of the Shinx surprisingly felt... nice. You rubbed your hands on the soft fur pressing on you. The Shinx in response began to purr. Huh, who knew that Shinx's purr.
