15213143.content:
Time drew on quite slowly as Rosa and you... well, Rosa and Snivy walked along the path while you sat on the latter's head, all three of you traveling in complete silence.

It was almost kind of boring; you had imagined a journey to be much more fun that this... well, you guessed your main objective wasn't really having fun or satiating some kind of lust for adventure: your own life was on the line here...

You were snapped out of your train of thought when you felt something poking you in the side; turning around, you saw it was the paw of your Pokemon.

Turns out you were so lost in your own thoughts that you had been completely ignoring Snivy for who knew how much time.

"Hm? What's up, Snivy?" you asked; noting that she had finally gotten your attention, the Pokemon lowered her arm and pointed it forward, to where Rosa was standing without moving,
"Sni?"

"Uh, Rosa?" you called, but she didn't hear you, so you quickly searched for her X-Transceiver number on your own device; once she heard it ringing, Rosa looked at it, then back at you.

"Yeah? What's up?" she asked.

"You zoned out."

"Snivy."

Rosa blushed and giggled.

"Oh, sorry... I was thinking about something..." she admitted, before shooting you an unreadable expression, though if you had to make a guess, you'd say it was determination.

"Ehh, wha-"

"So I was thinking, why don't we have a Pokemon battle?" Rosa interrupted; her Tepig, who had been silently walking alongside his trainer the entire time, looked at her,

"Te?" he spoke, emulated by Snivy, who sounded just as curious,
"Vy?"

"A battle?" you parroted back,
"I'm not sure, I've never had an actual battle before..."

"Neither have I! But it'll help us bond with our Pokemon, with each other and it'll be tons of fun, too!" Rosa replied excitedly.

You didn't really know how to reply, so instead you looked down at Snivy.

"What do you think?" you asked, but she didn't listen, as she and Rosa's Tepig were busy talking to each other.

"Perhaps it's better if we don't battle. I mean, wouldn't want to burn you or something..." the fire-type teased with a smug look.

Snivy glared.

"Shut up." she replied with a decent amount of annoyance in her voice, before she turned to you,
"I'm fine with it."

"Um... I'm just going to assume that's a yes." you said, turning to Rosa,
"So I'm in, I guess."

Th giantess smiled and began walking away, stopping when she put some distance between you and her; while she dropped her bag, your Snivy quietly picked you off of her head and placed you on the ground.

"Snivy?" she asked you, for the first time displaying a slight glint of concern in her eyes.

"Yeah, I'll be fine, I think." you reassured.

Snivy hesitated, but then adopted a straight face again as she nodded and turned her back to you.

"Let's do this, then." she cried, noting how Rosa's Tepig was already waiting, and so was his trainer.

"Okay, are you two ready?" Rose asked; then without really waiting for an answer, she declared,
"We'll make the first move! Tepig, use Tackle!"

Immediately, Tepig sprinted towards Snivy at full speed, catching you off guard - for such a small Pokemon, he sure was fast!

You were about to give a command as well, but when you opened your mouth to, you realized something: you had no idea what moves Snivy knew, aside from Vine Whip.

"Ehh..." you hesitated as Tepig approached your Pokemon...
"Dodge!"

On the very last second, Snivy jumped out of the way, resulting in Tepig stopping his run as his opponent swiftly landed beside him.

"Okay, use Vine Whip Snivy!" you ordered, though noticing that your Pokemon was shooting you a diffident look; regardless, she did as told... but Tepig seemed completely unfazed by the attack.

"A grass-type move won't have much effect on a fire-type..." Rosa pointed out, before adding,
"But it'll be super-effective the other way around! Use Ember, Tepig!"

The red and black swine followed the order and shot a wave of hot air through his nostrils, hitting Snivy, who cried her name in pain; Rosa's assault wasn't finished.

"Tepig, use Tackle once more!"

While Snivy was off-guard, Tepig charged at her and hit her, sending her flying; then, on Rosa's command, Tepig jumped surprisingly high and struck his opponent with tackle once more; this resulted in Snivy crashing to the ground.

You sighed. You didn't expect to win your first battle, but you didn't expect to lose this fast, either!

"Snivy!" you called, running towards where you saw Snivy landing; on the other side of the field, Rosa watched, shooting an apologetic look, before looking at Tepig,
"I guess we went a little overboard there, Tepig..."

"Tepig..." the small swine agreed, though he felt a smirk crawling on his cheeks.
'Told her so...'

In the meantime, you finally reached your Pokemon and rushed up to her face.

"Snivy, are you okay?" you asked in concerned manner; you doubted a couple of Tackles had done much damage to her, but she was definitely hurt.
"C'mon girl, talk to me,"

Much to your relief, you saw Snivy opening her brown eyes

"Sn-snivy..." she moaned, before you saw her expression changing as she eyed you; she looked very...
15213143.title: Creating bonds

choices: "I think we should get to town, first."
"Well, a little practice will do us good, I guess..."
152131431.content:
The expression on Snivy's face was hardly concerned about her latest and first loss. She looked more concerned about you though, you could tell when she muttered,

"I'm fine. How about you?"

"I'm fine, don't worry." you replied, guessing what she said to you and apparently guessing right, because she nodded and began to stand up; while she did, you felt the inexplicable need to comfort her, even though she seemed to barely care about losing her first battle.
"Hey, it's fine, anyway. Life's not always about winning, y'know."

Snivy began dusting herself off, muttering her own name under her breath in response.

Then, the grass-type lowered her paw for you to climb on, which you did, before Rosa and her Tepig, who wore a teasing smile on his face, approached.

"Whew, are the two of you alright?" the giantess asked, lowering herself to examine Snivy.

In the meantime, Tepig couldn't help it.

"Did I hurt you that much, Snivy?" he said teasingly, earning a cold stare from the grass-type, who didn't even reply.

"We're fine." you answered Rosa, before sheepishly looking down,
"Though I guess I did that bad for my first battle, hehehe..."

"Not nearly as bad as you believe, but... definitely could've gone way better." Rosa said, before wearing a reassuring smile,
"But, hey, we're all inexperienced here, so don't worry much about it. You'll learn in time."

You looked at her.

"We did barely land a hit." you recalled,
"How was that 'not nearly as bad as you believe'?"

At this, your Snivy sent you a glare.

"Sni..."

"Hey, relax! I'm not saying it was your fault!" you reassured,
"I mean, I didn't even know what moves you could use back there..."

At this, Tepig began laughing and Snivy groaned, once more looking at you with the same haughty look she looked at you when you first met her earlier today.

"H-Hey, don't give me that look, I didn't even know this was going to happen at the beginning of the day!" you defended.

Rosa giggled.

"Well, we can fix that easily!" she said as she pulled out her Pokedex from her bag, before looking at Snivy,
"Now Snivy, do you mind giving me-"

Snivy hissed and stepped back, clutching you to her chest.

"Okay okay! You keep him, girl!" Rosa hastily said, before pointing her Pokedex at your Pokemon,
"Let's see... okay, Snivy knows three moves: Tackle, Leer and Vine Whip, though you already knew about that last one since you used it against Tepig."

"And it barely did a scratch on him."

Tepig adopted a smug look and began waving his paw,

"Te-piiig..."

"That's because it was a grass-type move against a fire-type, you dummy! I've already told you!" Rosa said with a laugh,
"Snivy's a grass type, so her moves will be very effective on water, ground and rock-types, while they'll barely do anything to fire, poison and flying ones."

"Oh, I get it..."

Rosa smiled.

"That's great!" she said,
"Now, let's talk about strategy- oh, wait." she said, turning to dig into her bag once more, emerging with a red bottle that looked like a spray of some sort,
"First, give this to Snivy. It'll help."

You were handed the bottle, that was easy the same size as you were, if not slightly bigger.

"Uh... thanks?" you said,
"What is this, anyway?"

"A super potion."

"Ah. Okay." you said, turning to Snivy, comically holding the bottle like you were hugging it,
"Okay Snivy, this'll help you feel better..."

Snivy nodded her head, complying, as you began spraying her.

--

Ten minutes later Rosa sat down on the edge of the route, with her Tepig happily jumping on her lap; Snivy sat down beside her, you on top of her head.

It was kind of ironic how you were basically the opposite of Rosa with her Pokemon.

"Okay, now let's talk combos," Rosa resumed from where left off,
"You saw what I did back there, yes?"

"You went all-out."

"Wrong... well, not really, but the point is: have you seen how we used Tepig's moves?" the giantess asked, not waiting for an answer,
"Tepig used Ember to blind Snivy, then he attacked while she couldn't move!"

"Ouch..." Tepig mocked, earning a growl from Snivy.

"Oh, I get it now," you replied,
"But how can I do that...?"

"Well... with the moves Snivy knows, a combination of Leer, which can lower a Pokemon's defense, and Tackle can be very effective." Rosa explained, putting a finger to her chin in a cute thinking pose,
"Or maybe, you could use Vine Whip to incapacitate your opponent, that would be very useful, too. Limiting your opponent's movements while..."

"... While Snivy attacks them..." you continued, starting to understand.

You had never really studied about Pokemon and their moves before, but you were starting to understand, which was good: you certainly couldn't take on Mew, if that was the case, with the level of experience you had now.

"... Will result in a great attack!" Rosa happily finished,
"I see you're getting the 'hang' of it, hehehe. However, you should know that those combos won't always help if the moves are ineffective against other types. Don't worry though, Snivy'll learn more moves later on."

"I knew that." you said, recalling a gym battle you witnessed to, once: the challenger used a Serperior, and it was incredibly fast, not to mention powerful - it literally blew away the gym leader's own Pokemon.

Could your Snivy become that much powerful as well? Well, with enough practice, of course...

"Now, about abilities..." Rosa continued.

--

Rosa kept explaining things for a while more, about how moves could be used with a Pokemon's abilities to create devastating consequences on an opponent.

In your case, Snivy had the ability 'Overgrow', which powered up grass-type moves whenever Snivy's health was lowered enough.

Risky, but pretty useful if you needed to turn the tables in a hard battle

You listened closely to the advice you were given and, judging from the look on her face, Snivy was too.

Eventually though, Rosa stopped talking and looked at her X-transceiver. Her eyes went wide.

"Oh, look at the time!" she said, looking up - the sun was slowly setting,
"I didn't realize it was that late! Aw man, we're going to have to spend the night in Floccesy Town..."

"That doesn't sound bad..." you pointed out.

"Yeah, but that's assuming we get there in time!" Rosa said, her Tepig jumping off as she stood up; however, the giantess then hesitated, seemingly thinking. Or better, rethinking,
"... But hey, there's probably still a bit before the sun sets. So, why don't you and Snivy practice a bit?" she suggested with a confident smile.

"... You just contradicted yourself."

"Sn-Snivy."

Rosa rolled her eyes.

"I know, I know, geez..." she said,
"But I think you should practice, for a little bit at least. Y'know, to put what I've told you to the test. I'll leave it up to you though."

Unsure, you looked down at Snivy.

"What d'you say?" you asked. The grass-type shrugged,
"Sni."

So that left the choice up to you.

You thought about it for a moment. There would be plenty of time to practice later, you guessed, but maybe you should take some time to do as Rosa suggested?
152131431.title: Battle advice

choices: Rosa still wanted to get to Floccesy Town
Rosa and you decided to sleep in the forest
1521314312.content:
"Well, uh... a little practice will only do us good, I guess," you uncertainly said, looking down at Snivy,
"What do you say?"

"Sni." she replied with a shrug, seemingly fine with the idea.

Rosa pumped her fist in the air.

"That's the spirit!" she exclaimed excitedly, doing a little hop, before gesturing to her Tepig,
"And Tepig will help you out!"

Tepig's eyes shot open as he eyed his trainer with disbelief.

"E-Eh?" he exclaimed,
"Why do I have to play the training dummy!?"

"He doesn't seem very enthusiastic..." you pointed out.

In response, Rosa shot her Pokemon a disappointed look.

"C'mon Tepig, don't you want to help out our friends?" she asked; then, when her Pokemon turned his head, Rosa shrugged,
"Ah, well," she said, turning to you, winking,
"I guess he's scared he'll lose this one. Well, on to Floccesy Town!"

"W-Wait, what do you mean 'scared'!?" Tepig shouted, indignant.

"She means what she means," Snivy stepped in, deadpan,
"You're scared."

A cloud of smoke came out of Tepig's nose as he cried his name in determination (and annoyance).

Rosa giggled.

"Hehe, look who's up for the challenge," she said cheerfully, while you wondered what could have made Tepig change his mind so quickly.

Must have been something Snivy told him that made him so angry all of a sudden...

"Well, I guess we're up too, then," you said, though a bit worried.

"Perfect!" Rosa replied,
"You'll just battle Tepig like with a wild Pokemon while I watch. That way, Tepig can practice as well!"

"Fine by me." the fire-type swine said, eyes on Snivy, more smoke coming out of his nose,
"Bring it on!"

Snivy simply turned her back to her once-again opponent and began walking away; once she put some distance between herself and Rosa's Pokemon, she picked you from her head and let you down once more, before once more adopting that concerned look.

"Sni..." she said softly, hating having to split for you, even if for a battle; who knew what could happen to her very fragile trainer if he was left unguarded for too long!

Seeing her worried about you made you smile.

"Heh, don't worry, girl," you said, patting her scaly underbelly with a hand,
"I'll be fine."

Snivy lingered for a moment. Too much time for a certain Pokemon, who kindly reminded her of the battle,

"Hey! You comin' or not?"

Snivy sighed, then nodded her head as her face returned stoic, before she turned to face Tepig once more.

"Let's get this over with..."

"Okay Tepig... just do whatever you want!" Rosa said, remembering on the last second that she wasn't supposed to give orders.

She didn't have to repeat herself, because Tepig immediately shot a wave of hot wind towards Snivy.

"Dodge it!" you yelled; Snivy swiftly jumped to the side,
"Use Leer!"

Snivy sent a glare in her opponent's direction; Tepig stopped in his tracks.

"H-Hey, come on! Stop staring at me like that?" he protested.

"Like what?"

"Use Tackle!"

Hearing your shout, Snivy sprinted forward, so fast that it was actually hard to see her; when Tepig did, it was too late: your Snivy hit him, sending him flying back.

"Oh... that looked like it hurt..." Rosa commented, before sending you a thumbs-up,
"Great job!"

"Ow... lucky shot." Tepig whined upon getting back on all fours, glaring at Snivy,
"Now, let me show you what a real Tackle is like!"

That said, it was the swine's turn to sprint towards Snivy at full speed, too fast to dodge.

You, however, had an idea.

"Snivy, use Vine Whip and jump out of the way!" you ordered; Snivy looked at you for a split second, then did as instructed, and was surprised to discover it actually worked: Tepig kept going without having hit her, who was already in the air; you didn't hesitate.

"Now, latch onto Tepig and use Tackle!"

Snivy sent her vines to wrap around the belly of her opponent and used them to drag herself down, tackling the fire-type to the ground before hastily unwrapping him and jumping back, leaving a dizzy Tepig on the ground.

"Ugh..."

"Ouch... snap out of it, Tepig!" Rosa shouted, before blushing and covering her mouth with a hand; then, giggling, she added,
"Sorry, sorry..."

You ignored her and, with Tepig still on the ground, you saw your chance.

"That's it, Snivy, use Tackle again!" you yelled; Snivy, once again, sprinted towards Tepig and hit him as hard as she could, knocking him back.

While it was a hard blow, it still wasn't enough.

Tepig got back on his legs and, frustrated, shot an Ember in Snivy's direction.

"Dodge!" you shouted; Snivy did, but Tepig was still shooting fire towards her, who struggled to dodge.

Eventually, one if the attacks hit her, causing Snivy to wince; by the time she recovered, Rosa's Tepig was already performing Tackle again.

"Uh..." you said, before an idea came to your mind,
"Snivy, use Vine Whip and trip him!"

A vine hit Tepig's legs, causing him to trip and tumble several times.

"Let's end this," you murmured, before yelling,
"Use Vine Whip again, Snivy!"

"Snivy." your Pokemon replied as she began whipping Tepig over and over.

"Ow, ow, ow! Stop, stop!" he cried,
"I give up! I give up!"

The barrage finally ended; Tepig wasted no time and, after shakily getting up, he ran towards Rosa, crying his own name over and over.

Ross looked at you with a smile.

"Ehm... Tepig is unable to battle... well, sort of," she said,
"This victory goes to Snivy!"

"Alright!" you praised while the green giantess walked back to you,
"Great job, girl!"

The grass-type allowed herself to smile softly while she picked you up to place you on her head.

"Snivy."

--

After healing her Pokemon, Rosa turned to you with a smile.

"Well, that was incredible! You're both fast learners! And it looks like you have an incredibly strong bond already!" she praised.

"Heh..." you chuckled awkwardly,
"Though it's gotten pretty late..."

Rosa lost her smile and looked up; the sun was long gone.

"Aw man! I didn't even notice!" the giantess whined,
"Te, tepig!"

"So, what do we do now?" you asked.

"Um..."
1521314312.title: Practice makes perfect

choices: You eventually drifted off as well
Rosa suddenly picked you up, wanting to spend some time with you
You fell asleep, but were woken up much later by... Snivy and Tepig?
15213143122.content:
Rosa let out a sigh, before giggling.

"Well, I suppose we'll just have to camp here for the night," she said, before pouting,
"Too bad, though."

"It's not a bad idea." you replied, watching Rosa place her bag down, opening it to dig inside, letting out a,
"Hm-mh"

Finally, the giantess emerged from within her bag with a large tent.

"I don't suppose you have a tent of your own," she addressed you, letting a smirk crawl across her face,
"Meaning we're going to share..."

Immediately, you blushed.

"A-Ack, Rosa-!"

"Don't be shy now. I'm fairly sure you don't wanna sleep out here, and you don't take up much room anyway," she said, starting to unroll her tent,
"So lemme just pitch this. It'll take only a moment, promise~." she sang cheerfully, vaguely thrilled by the idea of sharing a tent.

You, on the other hand, were embarrassed by it, and Snivy was completely indifferent... as long as Rosa kept her hands off of you, anyway.

--

"Aaand, done!" Rosa said once she was finished with the tent, before turning to you, opening it with a hand, gesturing for Snivy to enter with the other.

The grass-type however seemed reluctant and stood in place.

Rosa pouted.

"Ah, c'mon..." she said, followed by Tepig,
"Teee..."

"Do as she says, Snivy," you whispered, patting on the head of the Pokemon, who obediently began walking towards the tent, followed by Rosa and her own Pokemon as she entered.

Once inside, Rosa began stretching, kicking off her shoes in the meantime, remaining in her pink socks.

"Ahh! What a day!" she exclaimed.

"Tell me about it." you muttered, your mind instinctively going back to Mew,
"Hey, Rosa?"

"Hm?"

"D'you think... we'll find Mew, eventually? I mean, it probably makes little difference to you, b-"

"What do you mean, dude?" Rosa interrupted, looking offended,
"I want to help you! As for Mew, she can't hide forever, right?"

You thought for a moment.

"I'm actually fairly sure she can," you said dejectedly,
"How do you explain she remained uncaught so far?"

Rosa's expression fell as well as she realized she had no reply for that.

"Um... ehh... w-well, you should look on the bright side!"

"And what would that be?"

The moment those words left your mouth, Snivy let out an indignant cry and poked you twice in the side to remind you that she was still there.

"Ah, yes... sorry, Snivy, hehe..." you apologized while your Pokemon crossed her arms,
"Sni."

"And then there's me, of course!" Rosa continued, earning a glare from Snivy that caused the giantess to rise her hands,
"Hey, don't give me that look, I wanna help, too!"

Snivy just grumbled her own name in response.

"... What I mean is, this could be much worse, y'know," Rosa addressed you again, crossing her legs and placing her hands on her knees,
"You could be alone, for example. Think of what would have happened if Snivy hadn't found you."

You did as told: if Snivy never popped out of that Pokeball, Bianca would probably have never found you, and you would be stuck on your own, to fend for yourself against pretty much anything; now, you had a partner, a companion who was willing to keep an eye on the two of you, and Professor Juniper who was conveniently working to find a way to restore your size.

"... You do have a point." you conceded, looking back at Rosa, who smiled.

"I knew you'd see it my way." she said, before drawing her bag closer to her,
"Now, who's hungry? I didn't pack much food, as I thought we'd be in Town by now, but hey, at that size, pretty much anything can be a whole meal to you."

At the mention of food, the apparently hungry Tepig skipped towards his trainer and waited for her to pull out dinner, tail wagging in anticipation as he cried his name over and over, asking for his belly to be filled; Snivy rolled her eyes.

You chuckled to yourself.

"Then I guess we can put that into the 'being tiny pros list'." you replied.

Rosa too giggled.

--

Dinner was fairly quiet.

While eating, you had a chance to look around, discovering that what Rosa had said before was true: the only thing occupying most of the space was Rosa herself; you and the two relatively small Pokemon didn't take much room, either, so that left enough space for the four of you to sleep comfortably in one place, though the thought was still somewhat embarrassing.

After dinner, Snivy let out a yawn.

"You tired, girl?" you asked, figuring that after the two battles she had with Tepig, she must have been exhausted.

"Sni." she answered, before looking in Rosa's direction warily; then, without warning, Snivy gripped you and removed you from her head, placing you onto the floor before coiling her entire body around you,
"Sni-vy." she spoke to Rosa, warning her of consequences if the trainer happened to even try to touch you.

You sighed.

"Sorry..." you said to Rosa, looking around: green walls surrounded you, making it impossible to escape unless you climbed Snivy.

Rosa laughed.

"Don't worry." she said,
"Your Snivy seems to like you a lot."

"Too much." you replied, before pointing out,
"Tepig too seems to think highly of you."

At the mention, Tepig jumped onto his trainer's lap with a happy cry of his name, the got comfortable and laid down much like a Lillipup would.

"D'aw..." Rosa cooed, beginning to pet the fire-type, who closed his eyes in relaxation.

A while later, both he and your Snivy fell asleep, one on Rosa's lap and the other coiled around you, acting as a fence.

A bit unsure what to do, you decided to catch some sleep well and sat with your back against Snivy's body, by her scaly stomach, judging from the sounds that came from within.

"Well... 'night, then." you said to Rosa, closing your eyes.

The giantess just smiled, finding the scene adorable.
15213143122.title: Camping with Rosa

choices: Snivy has run away with you! It seems that meeting was the last straw.
You're still in Snivy's grasp in the morning, Snivy still asleep.
A Pokemon has snuck into the tent and woken up Snivy.
Mew appears and gives you a hint to her location, and its in Unova!
Something Else?
152131431222.content:
You stayed lying on Snivy's scaly stomach for a good half hour trying to sleep, but couldn't. The events of the day were flying through your mind over and over, keeping you from reaching dreamland. Meeting the mythical pokemon Mew, then Mew shrinking you for its idea of a game. Meeting your new partner and going on an adventure.

Speaking of Snivy, she may be protective of you, but that's only a good thing in this situation, where nearly everything is a risk to your life, you only wished she wouldn't be so against Rosa as well. As you were thinking this, you felt two pillars of flesh surround you, and instinctively started struggling. After a second or so, you realized why you shouldn't really be struggling because the only person in the tent with you was Rosa.

You let yourself calm down and the fingers eventually deposit you on an open hand. Rosa then calls you with her X-Transceiver to overcome the sound barrier between the two of you. You pick up and say, "Hey Rosa, what's up?"

Rosa responded. "Nothing much, just wanted to talk without Snivy constantly glaring at me."

"Sorry about that, by the way. Snivy means well."

"No, it's no problem. It's pretty much a good thing you have such a protective partner to watch over you at your size. I've heard stories about starter pokemon being really disobedient to trainers, and at your size, a bad starter could've resulted in you being eaten before Bianca ever found you."

You sighed. "Yeah, I'm really grateful Snivy is how she is. I just wish she could tone it down around you."

Rosa laughed unintentionally, so she couldn't keep the volume down. Snivy and Tepig immediately woke up, which lead to Snivy realizing you were missing. Snivy looked around frantically, before spotting you on Rosa's hand. Her vines shot out at you at light speed and grabbed you from your perch and pulled you back into the scaly body of Snivy.

"He's mine! He's my trainer! Leave him alone!"

All you and Rosa heard, however, was, "Snivy Sni! Snivy Snivy Vy! Snivy!"

Snivy resumed the same position as before, but this time made sure to keep her arms around you and her vines covering the gap above you. It seems Snivy is really pulling out all the stops for this one, and not even Rosa could sneak you out of there undetected. Thankfully, your X-Transceiver was still in your hands, so you hear Rosa say, "Good Night", before hearing the call cut out.

After that talk with Rosa, your mind is cleared a lot more, so you're able to sleep soundly almost instantly. When you wake up...
152131431222.title: Midnight talk.

choices: You go towards the hot springs
You wait until she got out
You go inside her bag
153.content:
Suddenly, Mew floated back to where you are standing. You breath a sigh of relief and expected to be back to normal again. However, it wasn't what you were expecting as your surroundings are quickly changing. Once that's over, you soon found yourself in a brand-new location.

Instead of a grassy field, you are standing on a rocky mountain path that is incredibly hot; you are even sweating right now. You soon realized that Mew must've teleported you here, but why? From the looks of it, this appears to be on a large mountain with a steam air around it.

"Mew, why did you bring me here?" You asked.

"In order to experience an amazing moment of your life."

With that, she teleported away.

You are confused at what she meant by that as you highly doubt you will even experience anything good in the middle of a large volcano. With nothing left to do, you decided to go down and try to find some way to get back to normal.

As you travelled down, you began to notice something familiar about this place. While you never visited here before, you did read a book about a large volcano a long time ago. This volcano is known as Mt Chimney and is very tall; about 5000 feet tall to be exact! Kinda think of it, you did see the vast landscape of Hoenn at last. You immediately discovered that this IS Mt Chimney and because of it's great size, you can see nearly everything around the region. Honestly if you were at your original size, you would love to sit here and just take a look at sights from the mountain; you can even see your hometown of Petalburg City from up here. Is this what Mew wanted you to experience? You guess that must be the case, but it didn't really make any sense on why she shrank you for it.

After sightseeing for a while, you go back to your journey downwards. You couldn't stand here any longer due to the heat and going lower will make everything less hot for you to survive. You travel across the rocky terrain that makes up the mountainous route and realized that the more you travel down, the less warmer it gets. However, you suddenly felt something hot nearby and it almost feels like warm liquid coming from below. You slowly walk to the cliff and look down. You see a small lake that looks like a hot spring, but there's something there that really surprised you.

Resting on the hot springs is a girl but it's not just any girl, it's someone you think you recognized. She has long red hair that is tied in a ponytail, making it look spiky. The only thing she's wearing is a black bikini. Yep, this is none other than Flannery, the fire gym leader of Lavaridge Town. The reason you know her is because you once saw a battle between her and a trainer on TV once and ever since you saw her, you thought she was very hot like the fire Pokemon she uses, but in a good way. You also really wanted to see and get closer to her.

Wait a minute...

You finally realized what Mew meant by getting an amazing moment. The reason she shrank you and got you here was so you could get close to Flannery in secret. You could just take advantage of this new size and go see her up close without her even knowing your existence.

You look at her and was about to go down until you see a beach towel right next to the springs. It looks like she might be going to there to dry herself and relax under the sun. You thought of waiting for her to do so and go exploring across her body. Next to the towel, you can see a bag that may belong to her and began to think about going inside to explore around her clothes.

What do you do?
153.title: Way Too Hot

choices: It was Liza, meditating
It was Tate, Reading a book
It was both, and they were talking to each other
154.content:
How could you let this happen! You feel like a bit of an idiot, knowing how you didn’t take this as serious as you really should. Mew was a legendary, not only that but one of the most powerful ones. You know you thought it was just a cute playful Pokemon, but in retrospect that was stupid.

Now you paid the price, you were what... two inches tall at the moment. Maybe even less than that.

Looking over the ocean in front of you, you try to think about what you can do. The Mew flew that way, so no way you were gonna cross it. Although you do have a water Pokemon.

You were a Pokemon Trainer, with Pokemon. Here in the Hoenn Region, you started your journey a while ago. Now with six badges and ready for your seventh.

Hence is why you were at Mossdeep City. Ready to challenge the psychic twins Tate and Liza.

Your Pokemon, were even brought around to counter them. You only had two on you, as the rest were in your PC. A female Banette as well as a Male Crawdaunt. Both use to punish their types when you challenge them.

Well, that is pretty much not the plan at the moment. Then again, that was not the worst thing in the world.

Those two, they were psychics right? Maybe they can use their powers to help you! Granted, that was quite a leap but it was better than the alternative. Your Crawdaunt is not a fast Pokemon, at all. So chasing Mew was not an option.

Your Banette was fast, and could levitate. Let’s just say though... you would much rather be a bigger size than deal with that mischievous Pokemon.

So... the twins seem to be your best option. Looking back into the city from the shore, you swallow and you then move in.

-

It took, a real long while for you to actually get to the gym. You were so small, and everyone risked stepping on you. So it was understandable why you were having trouble.

That didn’t matter though, as you were by yourself right now at the front of the gym.

How do you get in there? The doors were giant and much too big for you to actually make your way in.

You try to figure out a way, even pushing your way into the door. You were far too weak though, so that was not an option.

“Well... better then nothing.” You say as you reach for your Pokeball. “Crawdaunt, come on out!”

Luckily, your Pokeball shrunk with you, but not the Pokemon. You crab was giant! Towering over you like a monster.

“Craw?” it said, looking it’s way around. Needless to say, it was expecting a battle, not to be outside.

“Hey, Crawdaunt down here!” You shout up to him for a long while. He listened, and looked down. His giant face close to you, as he was shocked about it.

“Craw!!!” He said as he brought his claw down. Your eyes wide open as you jump back.

“Woah! Don’t pick me up!” You say to your giant Pokemon as thankfully he listened. “Great, look I need you to open this door. Please.”

Your Pokemon, like most (Not Banette) is loyal, so he listens. Waddling his way over and... breaking the door with one Crab Hammer.

“O-Okay, I guess that works. Um... come back before you get found and blamed.” You say to the Pokemon as you return him. Although you were weak and powerless, at least you have your two strong Pokemon. Granted you were pretty sure you weren’t going to bring out Banette.

Every since you got her as a Shuppet across on the mainland, she has been trouble. Pranks, Scares and Mischief was her game. When she evolved into Banette, she even found a way to get into more mischief. A variant of Curse was her favourite.

Pretty much, she links your body’s feeling to hers, as she then starts to either hurt herself, to hurt you, or tickle herself to tickle you.

Somehow, she turned the ticklish option into the worse of the two.

Regardless, as you move over towards the door, that was now opened. You walk among the shattered glass, getting in as you look around. Now where were you going to go? You have never been to this place before, so you might as well guess.

You see a hallway not so far away, so you logically take it. Taking long steps as you move forward and in.

The hallway was big, but empty which left you confused. Guess there was not much people in this Gym. You have no idea why, but since it lowered your chance of actually getting stepped on, you were not going to question it.

So you just kept moving as you arrived at something that interested you. A giant door to the side, with the title.

‘Twins Room’

Yep, this was where you were going to find them. You could hear shifting inside, so at least one of them had to be in. How are you going to get in their this time.

Well Crawdaunt can break his way in and... oh no, wait. The door was slightly open.

Well that made things much simpler, so you simply move your way. Getting right between the door and the wall as you step in.

These two shared the same room, and apparently it wasn’t split into two. In fact it seemed to be shared, as their beds were right next to each other in the middle of the room. A large desk on one side, a closet as well as drawers on the other side. The room didn’t look like it was catered to a boy or a girl, or either. It just seemed like an average room.

However, the room wasn’t the thing you were interested in. Instead it was the giant twins that you were looking for.

You looked and saw that ______________
154.title: You Are Mossdeep In Trouble

choices: Yes, she lets you go
No, cause she wants you to stay with her
No, she forces you to stay with her!
No, she wants a gym battle (Pokemon)
No, she wants a gym battle (You vs Liza!)
1541.content:
You looked and saw it was one of the two twin gym leaders! The girl one, Liza you think her name is. You could not be happier about how this turned out, you need to go and get her attention right now!

She was meditating on the ground right now, her legs crossed her and her feet bare. You need to get her attention simple as that. You don’t know much about psychics, but you know they have powers. Powers that might be able to help you.

After all it was a psychic Pokemon that shrunk you, maybe a psychic person can help you.

You get real closed to the giant sitting girl, looking how intimidating she was. Not only that, but a bit pretty. For her age at least.

She seemed to be deep in thought, so you were wondering how you were going to get her attention. You don’t want to shock her, you want her to remain calm and not to jump to conclusions.

Looking around for a bit, you found how you are gonna get this giant girls attention. You move around, getting real close to her foot as you feel it for a couple of seconds.

Then you push, rubbing it as you try to make sure she feels it. You push as hard as you can, really putting your back into it. All in front of you was her giant clean sole, which could probably easily step on you. So it was a good thing you were getting her attention now, rather than later.

For Liza, she was awaken out of her meditation, feeling something against her foot. While she was focusing er power, she still noticed it. Which was good, as she looked down at her sole, seeing you! Not seeing you as a doll, or a small Pokemon, but as a human.

Her eyebrows lifted looking at you, a little bit shocked about it but not enough to actually throw her off. How did this happen? Why is a small boy rubbing her feet? You looked older than her, and if she looks hard she can see two small Pokeball’s on your belt. Pausing for a couple of seconds she looks at you as she speaks.

“Uh... can I help you?” You jump and jerk at her sudden talks, almost tripping back. Something she found adorable, and was the reason why Liza wore a smile on her face as you look up at her.

“Oh good, you found me. Wasn’t as hard as I thought.” You say with a smile, as this could not be better. You move around as she still had her legs crossed, going before her as you tidy yourself up. You look up to her towering form as you begin to talk.

“Right, hi... Liza! Big fan first off. I’m a Pokemon trainer, who is actually here to challenge you and your brother funnily enough.” You say to her as she listened. Still it was intimidating in front of her. “Anyway...”

“Hehehe, go on.” She said giving you motivation to keep on talking.

“Well, I was planning on facing you and your brother, and then I went to sleep. Then a Mew showed up!”

“A Mew?” She questioned, surprised at that bit. “Is that why you are small?”

“Yeah, I played around with the Mew... and it shrunk me. My own fault really. So, the Mew wanted me to chase it, but considering that... I can’t this size. I came to you!”

And now she has pieced it together. That’s why you were here, because you thought that Liza with her psychic powers could help. Sadly, she could not. Moving her hand to her back she looked sheepishly at you.

“Sorry, I know why you are here then and i’ve never have grown something with my powers, not even affect something’s size. Sorry.”

“Great.” You say in a deadpanned expression. “Guess I should of expected it. It was a long shot.”

“What is your name by the way?” She questioned down to you as you realise you haven’t told her yet. You reply and she smiles. Moving her giant body around. She wasn’t aware of the effect this was going to have on you. Moving her giant body and laying down on her stomach, bringing her face closer to you as she rests her two knuckles under her chin. Her feet kicking around as she smiles at you. “Nice name, so... if I were going to guess, Mew would be the only way you could grow big. I doubt any other psychic Pokemon could overpower Mew’s.” She said logically. “Although if you find a Pokemon that knows Growth, and they somehow use it on you. You could have Mew’s shrink on you, but you could use the growth as well to counter it!”

Your eyes went wide. “L-Liza you are a genius!” You say happy. That could be a good strategy you could use.

“Although that is also farfetched. Growth is an internal move, and it doesn’t use the way it’s described. It can’t just magically Dynamax. So I guess Mew is still your bet.” She said looking over. Only now realising she just kind of stepped on your dreams. “Oh uh... sorry. Think about it like this way, there is a lot more fun things to do with your size than normal! You could eat food so much bigger than you, a bottle of water would last you a day. Um... you can have a giant king’s size bed regardless of what you are actually on. You never have to wait in lines, you could move through under the feet. Am I helping?” The caring girl questioned.

“Just a little. Well, thanks for hearing me out Liza. Guess, I got to go find Mew.”

“By yourself?” She questioned as you turned around.

“Don’t worry. I got strong Pokemon, they were probably going to beat you and your brother if i’m being honest. Anyway, goodbye Liza!” You say waving. Is this the end?
1541.title: Liza Meditating

choices: You accepted the offer
You declined
Suddenly, the door opened and Tate came in
15412.content:
"Wait!"

You halted in your own tracks and turned around upon hearing the young gym leader yelling.

Once she was back in your line of sight, you noted her hastily moving herself to rise to her feet before getting up, rising to her full height, which was quite impressive for a kid her age.

"Hm, yeah?" you asked while she walked closer to you, stopping when you were standing mere inches from her bare toes; you had to look up for several seconds in order to be able to look at her face.
"What is it, Liza?"

In response, Liza looked elsewhere; you noted a blush suddenly appearing on her cheeks as she began fidgeting her fingers nervously.

"He-"

"I can't let you leave!" she suddenly blurted out, before realizing what she had said, clearing her throat and resuming in a less nervous tone,
"I mean, you shouldn't leave."

"What? Why?"

Liza placed her hands behind her back and adopted a solemn expression that you best described as adorable.

"Because, trainer, it would be very dangerous for someone your size to challenge the world by yourself." Liza explained,
"I think it would be very unwise of you to do so."

She did have a point, you guessed, but that didn't change the fact that you needed to find Mew.

"Oh." you said, before offering a smile,
"I appreciate that but, y'know, I'm not on my own. I have my Pokemon with me. They're to thank if I even got in here... though now I guess it was a bit pointless."

Liza pouted.

"Don't say that!" she chided, before realizing she had shouted and placing a hand over her mouth, blushing; then, timidly, she resumed,
"Excuse me... but I still think you won't be completely safe. Even if you did find Mew, I doubt you could defeat it in battle since it's one of the mightiest legendaries... and it's also sooo cute!"

As Liza adopted dreamy eyes while thinking of Mew, you pondered her words and discovered that they made perfect sense: your Pokemon may have been strong enough to take on Liza and Tate and maybe win, but were they strong enough to take on a legendary?

Although...

"She didn't mention that." you pointed out,
"She told me to go find her, not fight her."

Liza finally stopped daydreaming about finding a Mew herself and finally turned back to you.

"Oh, it's a gir... wait. Hehehe, sorry," the young giantess giggled, realizing she had lost the main track of her thoughts; she focused back on you and once more adopted a serious expression,
"Maybe it's like you say, trainer, but there's still no telling if Mew is going to give you back your size even if you manage to find her." Liza pointed out.

You looked at her for a few seconds, wondering just what she was trying to say.

Then, with a shrug, you said,

"Perhaps. But what other choice do I have?"

Liza looked away.

"Oh, you know, you could always..." she mumbled the last part so lowly that not even you could hear her, not that there was anybody else to listen.

"Um... what was that?"

Liza's face flushed bright red once more.

"I said..." she said, closing her eyes,
"That maybe you could stay... with me."

Silence fell between you and the giantess; you kept your gaze glued to her while she once again looked away, blushing.

Eventually, you broke the silence.

"... Why?" you asked,
"Why would you want me to stay you?"

In response, Liza finally turned to you.

"Well, you know, I wish to, um, assist you," she kindly replied, bending to place her hand palm-up in front of you; getting the hint, you climbed on as she rose up, lifting her palm as well.
"You know, I can't help you with your size, at least for now, but I can take care of you!"

Liza was sure she had concealed it well, but she was actually thrilled by the idea of taking care of a small person.

"Um... that's very kind of you, but... you're a gym leader, no?" you pointed out. She nodded,
"If I stayed, I'd be stuck in this city, and I need to find Mew. I don't think you would be able to leave this gym, and therefore I wouldn't be able to go and seek for Mew..."

Liza bit her lip - you had a solid point.

"... We'll think of something," she replied after a long hesitation. Then, she shot a smile that was intended to be reassuring,
"I could always try to make my Pokemon to learn some Psychic move that might help you grow... or I could even learn it myself... or maybe Tate's psychic powers and mine could be strong enough to actually grow you. I'm sure we'll come up with something, eventually..."

After that, Liza fell silent and you fell into thought.

The offer you were given was admittedly pretty good and surely the best you had since it was also the sole one; on one hand, the gym leader was right, staying would be much safer than just traveling aimlessly until you found Mew.

On the other hand, you had Pokemon, and were fairly sure that, with them, your chances of survival were as good as anyone's... as long as your Banette didn't come up with something mischievous that implied with your new size... yeah, you guessed Banette was was going to sit in her Pokeball for a while.

Shaking your head, you focused back on Liza's offer and pondered it for a few more minutes.

"Have you made your choice, then?" the giantess spoke.

You looked back at her.
15412.title: Liza's offer

choices: You lose
Have you seen how one sided this is! Of course you lose!
15415.content:
As you turn around, planning on leaving and moving onto another tactic, something else happened. Something that you were not really expecting, a giant foot came in your way. You jumped around and jumped back, a bit freaked out as you looked up to Liza.


“Uh... what’s happening?” You question her as she smiled.

“Well,” She said with a certain level of giddiness in her voice. “You came here for a Gym Battle, so I think it’s only fair you get one!” She said this, and you were confused.

“Uh... it’s great and all, but I did not really want to.... I have more pressing things to worry about at the moment.” You say to her, finding your rules. “So... let me just figure this out, get my height back and we can do it later.”

“Nope!” She said stomping her foot down once again, getting you to panic. “We are having one right now, it’s the Gym Leader rule. once you enter a Gym, you can’t lose until the battle is over.”

“That’s not a real rule.”

“It is, trust me i’m a Gym Leader.” She said with a smile down to you.

You didn’t want to do this, but it was not like you were gonna convince this giant girl otherwise.

“Sure, fine whatever. My Pokemon won’t hear my commands and I won’t be able to see the battle at all, but no it’s fine. Just carry me over to the battlefield.” You said not that enthusiastic about it.

“Hehehe, actually this will be just as good.” She says to you, taking you over and placing you down in the middle. She placed you down into the middle of the room as you see her trying to move stuff under the bed creating more floor space.

“Here, isn’t it a little...”

“You were gonna say small weren’t you?” She questioned with a laugh.

“Well, if you want to ruin your room. Fine, i’ve go-”

“We aren’t gonna need them!” Liza said, quickly moving over and getting onto her knee. She got onto her knee and she grabbed your belt.

“H-Hey! Please don’t do that!” You say trying to swat her giant controlling finger away from you. No matter how much you tried though, you lost your belt and your Pokemon. “Those are mine!”

“You can get them back if you win.” She said playfully, putting it on the top shelf. You were so confused about it, and you were not really sure how you were going to do it.

“I’ve got no Pokemon!” You say back to her as she just rolls her eyes around.

“I won’t use mine either. It will be Gym Leader, versus Challenger!” She said happily and with a smile.

“What?”

“Come on, this is a once in a lifetime event, I never get to be bigger than my challenger! You are gonna be the most fun challenge!” She said with a laugh and a giggle. You just look to the towering little girl, unsure of what she was truly doing?

“Why?”

“Cause I want to, and you can’t escape until you go.” She said as you realise the true danger you were in. If she was not going to let you go unless you do this, you can do nothing about it. You pause and look at her for a couple of seconds before accepting it.

“F-Fine. I’ll do this but you got to let me leave afterwards! You have got to!” You say to her as she smiled down to you.

“Oh, you are just so cute,” She said bringing her finger down to you and patting you on the nose. Her finger being big enough to push on your face. “Yep, don’t worry you can leave!”

“Good be-”

“If you beat me that is.” She said as you look at the giant psychic twin.

“W-What?”

“If you can’t, i’m gonna go around and keep you! I want to keep you, and make you mine. So that’s on line. You win, you get the badge and you can leave, if you don’t I get you!”

You were so left confused about this, cause it did not make any sense to you. You have no idea why she would do this, but the stakes have never been higher. Should you just say no, should you just reject her idea? Walk away. What’s the worst she can do if you do that?”

Putting the theory to the test, you get moving and prepare to leave. However her giant bare foot comes down onto you!

“Hehehe, trying to escape are we. You got to play, or I might just step in the wrong place.”

“D-Did you just threaten to kill me!” You panic at her, as she giggles.

“A threat is nothing wrong, plus I doubt I would actually kill you. Anyway, so you are playing?”

“Guess since I don’t have a choice!” You shout to her as she smiled.

Happily Liza stepped over you as she closed the door. Despite her interest changing 18 degrees, she was still talking the same way before. Does she not see what she is doing to you, She is forcing you into a game you don’t want to play with vicious threats and if you lose, you are hers forever.

“Okay, so the game is simple.” Liza said standing opposite of you. Just seeing her so big, it was pretty clear the advantage she had over this. Hopefully she picks something you can actually win. “It’s gonna be a battle, you against me!”

Okay, clearly this girl is too smart for that. Did she just say you against her.

“Liza, there is no way I can actually win that!”

“Hehehe, I know that’s the beauty of it and... the match will officially commence!” She shouted and just like that, it was on. The match was afoot and it was time to fight.

Your eyes wide open, as you brain tries to attack you with things you can do, but what can you do!?

155.title: More Slots

Suddenly, two people came by (Dawn and Prof. Rowan)
